These are small scale businesswomen in the northern city of Makeni. They have come to SMT for the very first time to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each to enable them expand their businesses. With a loan of SLL 500,000, they will be able to add more stocks into their businesses, make more sales, and more profit. Consequently, they will be able to improve their standard of living by sending their children to school, feed and clothe them. 

Kadiatu D. (left) is the leader of this group. She was born in Sanda village, in northern Sierra Leone. She is now forty-seven years of age, married to a lecturer and they have two children together – one of her children is attending Junior Secondary School I (JSS I) and the other is in Primary School III. Kadiatu sells rice. She has been selling rice for more than twenty years now. She will invest her share of the loan into her rice business. Depending on the price for a bag of rice (price keeps fluctuating), she will buy five or six bags of rice to add to the two bags of rice she is currently trading with.

loans.use: Buy bags of rice for trading

loans.name: Abu

texts.en:
Abu J. sells used clothes in Makeni city. He wants a loan of SLL 2000000 to enable him to improve his business. With a loan, Abu will be able to add one bale of Ladies Tops, one bale of Girls Skirts, and one bale of Truck Pants. This will eventually lead to more sales and improve profits. He will thus be able to take greater care for his nine children and wife.

Abu was born in a village call Sanda Taindaran, in northern Sierra Leone. He is now forty years old. His wife is a businesswoman too – both of them are managing the same business. Their children are attending schools – three are in primary school and six are in secondary school. Abu has twenty years of experience in selling used clothes.

loans.use: Buy additional stock of used clothes

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
la Sra. Felicita G. C. tiene 41 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y usada, su negocio lo tiene en su casa de habitacion. 
en estos momentos Felicita Necesita un credito para comprar un fardo de ropa usada y varios trajes y ropa nueva para niños, ya que se aproxima la navidad y muchas personas ya le tienen encargado trajes y ropa, muchas de sus prendas las vende al credito y a final de cada mes le estan pagando lo que le deben.
su negocio esta creciendo poco a poco, espera que para el año que viene todo mejore y que su negocio prospere cada dia mas.
su meta es poder remodelar su casa de habitacion y hacer mas grande su tienda de ropa para dar una mejor atencion a sus clientes.
muchas personas compran ropa usada ya que es barata y de buena calidad.
texts.en:
Felicita G. C. is 41 years old, and dedicates herself to selling new and used clothing. She runs her business out of her home. Currently, Felicita needs a loan to buy a bundle of used clothing as well as some new children’s clothing. With the Christmas season approaching, many people have asked her for such products. She sells a good deal of her items on credit, and is paid at the end of each month for what she is owed. Her business is growing little by little, and she hopes that things improve in the coming year and that her business prospers more each and every day. Her goal is to remodel her home, and therefore be able to expand her clothing store and provide service to her customers. Many people buy used clothing, given that it is economical and of good quality.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy new clothing, as well as a bundle of used clothes.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Augustine B.

texts.en:
Augustine B. T. sells used clothes for men in Makeni city. He wants a loan of SLL 3,000,000.00 to enable him to improve his business. With a loan, Augustine will be able to add two bales for Three Button Shirts, three bales of Jeans for men and two bales of Men Shirts. This will eventually lead to more sales and improve profit. He will thus be able to take greater care for his six children, wife and parents.

Augustine was born in a village call Yele, in northern Sierra Leone. He is now thirty-seven years old. His wife is a businesswoman too – both of them are managing the same business. Their children are attending schools – four in primary school, one in secondary school and one is not of school going age. Augustine has twelve years of experience in selling used clothes.

loans.use: Buy additional stock of used clothes

loans.name: Las Aguilas Group

texts.es:
La señora Julia T. M.  a sus 37 años ha logrado alcanzar lo que tanto había soñado. lograr su independencia económica, por mucho tiempo laboro para otros en diferentes empresas. con la liquidación que recibió de su ultimo trabajo decide poner un negocio,  en la zona donde vivía no había ninguna vendedora de hamburguesas no lo pensó dos veces y se compro su carrito sanguchero  aun cuando no le alcanzaba se hizo un préstamo y con mucho sacrificio pudo lograrlo.
Ella cuenta que a pesar que en su barrio no había luz ella siguió con sus planes de inagurar su nuevo negocio de venta de hamburguesas  para esto invito a todas sus amistades y vecinos  con una oferta por inauguración todo a mitad de precio con el fin  de que conozcan su negocio y prueben su producto  le fue muy bien y lo que mas la animo fueron las felicitaciones y los buenos deseos  de sus allegados, actualmente sigue con su negocio y le va muy bien a pesar que apareció competencia  sus clientes son fieles a ella y siempre le compran..EDAPROSPO le ha sido de mucha ayuda  por que antes compraba sus insumos de a pocos ahora con sus prestamos compra por cantidad y para todo el mes esto hace que pueda tener mas ganancias y de esa forma ayuda a su esposo en la manutención de la casa ya que tiene 3 hijos pequeños, con el paso del tiempo ella ve que a progresado muchísimo antes vendía en la calle. actualmente tiene un local en su propia casa que esta acondicionando poco a poco esto lo  hace por la comodidad de sus clientes que ahora entran a comer  su actual préstamo lo utilizara en los acabados de su local le pondrá un piso bonito y mejorara el baño  en el futuro quiere ser la primera en vender PIZZAS en su barrio es por eso que ahorra para comprarse su maquina  sabe que lo va a lograr y es para eso que trabaja con mucho empeño.
texts.en:
Mrs. Julia T. M., at 37 years of age, has finally achieved what she had always dreamed of: financial independence. For a long time she worked for others at different businesses. With the severance pay from her last job she decided to start her own business. In the area where she lived there was no hamburger vendor; she didn't think twice, and bought a sandwich cart. At the time she could not afford it, so she obtained a loan and with a lot of sacrifice succeeded. Julia says that despite the fact that the neighborhood had no electricity, she went ahead with her plans and inaugurated her new business selling hamburgers. For this event she invited all her friends and neighbors with a special opening deal of half off everything, so that they would find out about her business and taste the products. The opening went very well; what encouraged her the most was the congratulations and good wishes from her close friends and relatives. Currently her business is running well, and, despite the fact that now there is competition, her customers are loyal and continue to buy from her. EDAPROSPO has been a great help to her, as before she bought her raw materials little by little, but with loans she can buy the materials in greater quantities, thus increasing her profits. In this way she helps her husband with the household costs, as they have 3 small children. Over time, Julia has seen the business progress a lot: before she sold in the street, and now she has a store in her own house that she is improving little by little, to provide more comfort to the customers who now come in and eat. This current loan will be used to put the finishing touches on her premises: she will put in a nice floor and improve the bathroom. In the future Julia wants to be the first to sell pizzas in her neighborhood, and for this reason she is currently saving to buy a machine to produce them. She knows she will succeed and thus works with a lot of determination.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve her small restaurant selling hamburgers

loans.name: Judith

texts.fr: T. Judith est née en 1977 à Bohicon, dans le département du Zou au Bénin. C’est depuis 18 ans que Judith vit à Cadjèhoun à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à MOINDRAU Christophe, un tailleur, Judith est mère de trois enfants. Le couple a un autre enfant à charge. Certains des enfants sont scolarisés. A partir des revenus issus de son activité, Judith vient en aide à son mari Christophe dans l'entretien et l'éducation de ses enfants. Judith n’a pas été à l’école. C’est depuis 11 ans que Judith vend des céréales (haricot, maïs) à son domicile. Judith s’approvisionne à Cotonou. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Afin d’augmenter le volume de son activité et de vendre beaucoup en période de fêtes de fin d’année, Judith sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Judith ambitionne plus tard acquérir des biens matériels à partir des revenus issus de son activité.
texts.en:
Judith T. was born in 1977 in Bohicon, in the county of Zou in Benin. For the last 18 years, Judith has lived in Cadjèhoun in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to Christophe MOINDRAU, a tailor, and she is the mother of three children. The couple supports another child. Some of the children attend school. With the income from her business, Judith helps her husband, Christophe, with the care and education of her children. Judith never went to school. For the last 11 years, Judith has been selling cereals (beans, corn) from her home. Judith acquire her merchandise in Cotonou. She is an old time ALIDé customer who always pays back her loans. In order to increase the volume of her activity and to sell more during the year-end festivities, Judith is requesting a third loan from ALIDé. Judith’s ambition is to be able to acquire material assets with the income generated by her activity.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cereals (Bags of beans)

loans.name: G.s. Milagro De Jesus Group

texts.es: El Grupo solidario Milagro de Jesús está conformado por Maura Elena  y Perfecta Rosa. Maura tiene 31 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. Su actividad económica es la venta de refrescos y verduras, hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este oficio, por lo que es una de sus principales fuentes de ingresos. Por lo que  solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de verduras frutas frescas para la elaboración de sus deliciosos refrescos. En cambio su amiga Perfecta Rosa tiene 65 años de edad. Tiene 3 hijos pero todos  trabajan de manea independiente, como toda mujer luchadora decide realizar la venta de abarrotes, por lo que es ella quien se hace cargo los gastos de su familia. Por lo que solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo y así realizar la compra de sus productos. ambas sueñan con llegar a lo alto y mejorar cada día la situación de sus hogares.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Miracle of Jesus is made up of Maura Elena and Perfecta Rosa. Maura is 31 years old, and has 3 children in her care. The business she has dedicated herself to for the past 5 years involves the sale of refreshments and vegetables, which is her primary source of income. She is requesting a loan for working capital to buy vegetables and fresh fruits to make her delicious drinks. On the other hand, her friend Perfecta Rosa is 65 years old. She has 3 children, who now work independently. Like many struggling women, she decided to sell groceries since she is the one in charge of generating income for the family. She is requesting a loan to use as working capital, to invest in the purchase of her products. Both dream of reaching the top, and of improving the standard of living in their homes each and every day.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
This is Zainab M., a small scale businesswoman in Makeni city, northern Sierra Leone. Zainab sells slippers/flip-flops at Rogbaneh Road, Makeni’s busiest road. Zainab is seeking a loan from SMT/Kiva for the second time in order to help her further improve her business. With her previous SMT/Kiva loan, she was able to improve her business and personal life. Having repaid her previous loan successfully, she is now requesting a new loan of SLL 4,000,000.00.

Madam M. is now age thirty-eight; she was born in a village call Sanda Taindaran, in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a businessman and they have seven children plus two foster children. Six of their children are in secondary school and one is in primary school.  Zainab M. has been selling slippers for eleven years now. Zainab will use this loan to buy dozens of different types of slippers – “comfort”, “commot” “puma” and “yeyi”, as they are locally called.

loans.use: Buy additional slippers for resale

loans.name: G. Améline

texts.fr: G. G. Améline est née en 1979 et est mariée à KPADONOU Zachée un hôtelier. Le couple n’a pas encore d’enfant, mais a un enfant à charge. Il y a près de deux ans que Améline vit au quartier Atropocodji à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, avec son mari et l’enfant à sa charge. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Améline n’a fait que le cours primaire à l’école. C’est depuis une douzaine d’année que Améline vend des produits de toilette et de beauté, ainsi que des mèches de façon ambulante. Améline s’approvisionne à Cotonou. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé  ayant déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de l’institution, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Afin d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de satisfaire plus sa clientèle, Améline sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Améline souhaite satisfaire les besoins de son ménage à partir des revenus de son activité.
texts.en:
Améline G. G. was born in 1979 and is married to Zachée KPADONOU, an innkeeper. The couple does not yet have any children, but are supporting one child. For almost two years, Améline has been living with her husband and the child in their care in Atropocodji in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. The couple together provides for the family’s expenses.

Améline only attended elementary school. For close to twelve years, Améline has been selling toiletries and beauty products door-to –door, as well as hair extensions. She has already received two loans from the institution; those loans have been fully repaid.

In order to increase her stock of goods and to satisfy her customers, Améline is requesting a third loan from ALIDé. Améline wishes to meet her household needs with the income from her activity.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hair extensions, hair straightener products, oil and ointments for hair and other beauty products.

loans.name: Wilber

texts.es: Wilber es casado, no tiene hijos, trabaja como asesor pedagogico del Ministerio de Educación, esta solicitando su primer crédito  con AFODENIC, para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda como es terminar de construir una habitación, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa la cual trabja como docente, a pesar que no tienen hijos ayudan a sus familia ya que son de escasos recursos económicos,  Wilber es un joven con muchos deseos de superación profesional y laboral, actualmente esta estudian su primer año en ciencias de Educación en la Universidad URACCAN , el ha ido poco a poco mejorando su vivienda  desde que la obtuvieron para tener un hogar digno para su familia que cumpla con las condiciones que la familia necesita y su sueño es ser un profesional con mucha experiencia, salud y trabajo
texts.en:
Wilber is married. He does not have children. He works as a pedagogical advisor in the Ministry of Education. He is asking for his first loan with Afodenic to improve his house by finishing the construction of a room. He has his wife’s help. She works as a teacher. In spite of not having children, they help their families because they have scarce economic resources. Wilber is a young man with a great desire for professional and work success. He is currently studying his first year in the science of education in the Uraccan University. He has been improving his house little by little since they got it. He does this to have a decent home with the necessary conditions for his family. His dream is to be a professional with much experience, health, and work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room

loans.name: Cristino Saba

texts.es:
El señor Cristino ha trabajado con Ceprodel durante cuatro años y en ese lapso ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda con los seis créditos que ha trabajado con Ceprodel.

El crédito solicitado es para la compra de ladrillos para su vivienda con el fin de darle un mejor estilo de vida a sus hijos que tanto requieren del apoyo de su padre.
texts.en:
Cristino has worked with Ceprodel for four years. In this amount of time he has improved the condition of his house with the six loans he has had working with Ceprodel. The loan he is asking for is to buy bricks for his house. This is to give his children a better style of life. They really need their father’s support in this.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bricks and cement

loans.name: Espérence

texts.fr: A. Espérence est née en 1964 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Espérence vit depuis une vingtaine d’année à Cadjèhoun à Cotonou. Espérence est mariée à DAHOUNDO Luc, un agent au PTT au Bénin. Le couple a quatre enfants à charge, dont trois sont leurs enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés et vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Espérence vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Espérence n’a pas été à l’école. Il y a une dizaine d’année que Espérence vend de la bouillie (faite à base de maïs, accompagnée de sucre), et produit également des jus d’ananas qu’elle vend de façon ambulante. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Espérence s’approvisionne. Espérence est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. C’est en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et d’agrandir la taille de son activité, pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, que Espérence sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Espérence A. was born in 1964 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Espérence has lived in Cadjèhoun in Cotonou for about 20 years. She is married to Luc Dahoundo, an agent at the PTT in Benin. The couple has four children in their care, of which three are their own. All the children are in school and live with their parents. Espérence helps her husband manage the family's expenses. Espérence never went to school. For 10 years, Espérence has sold gruel (made from corn, with sugar added), and she also makes pineapple juice that she sells door-to-door. She gets her stock at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Espérence is a long-time client of Alidé and she has repaid all of her previous loans. She is requesting a third loan through Alidé so she can increase her working capital and increase the size of her business to better meet the needs of her customers.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn and pineapples

loans.name: Carmen De La Flor

texts.en:
Carmen, 27, is a single woman living in Cusco. She is part of the Amancaes group. She works for a tourism agency here in the city and also owns a small grocery store called “Multiservicios Nelli’s” in the neighborhood of Santiago. In her grocery store, she sells various foods and products for the local community after buying all of the goods wholesale. Each day she makes between 40 and 50 soles (about $13 to $17) in earnings from her bodega, or small shop. 

With the loan she receives from Kiva, Carmen hopes to better her business by buying more products for the store. Specifically, with the Christmas season approaching, she will purchase various holiday foods and items to sell.

loans.use: To buy holiday products for her store

loans.name: Portocarrero  Anchante

texts.es: La Sra. María Portocarrero tiene 34 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material noble junto a su cónyuge y sus 2 menores hijos en el caserio de Santa Dominguita, cuenta con un negocio de venta de abarrotes, golosinas, verduras, bebidas gaseosas y otros desde hace 3 años aproximadamente el cual ha implementado con mucho esfuerzo, su esposo se dedica a la actividad agrícola en terrenos de su padre desde hace 10 años. Ambos laboran para brindar buena educación para sus hijos y gracias a sus ahorros han podido construir su casa. Actualmente solicitan financiamiento para incrementar su negocio por campaña navideña. Sus sueños son poder seguir creciendo en sus propios negocios para bienestar de su familia. La Sra. María agradece el apoyo que le brindemos a través del préstamo que le podamos otorgar.
texts.en:
María Portocarrero is 34. She lives in her own house made of good material with her life partner and their two minor children in the Santa Dominguito village. She has had a business selling groceries, sweets, vegetables, soft drinks, and other things for approximately three years. She set it up with great effort. Her husband has been working as a farmer on his father’s land for ten years. They both work to give their children a good education. Thanks to their savings, they have been able to build a house. They are currently asking for a loan to increase her business for the Christmas season. Their dreams are to be able to keep growing in their own businesses for the well being of the family. María is grateful for the support of the loan that we can give her.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rachidatou

texts.fr: R. Rachidatou est née en 1952 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Rachidatou réside au quartier Cadjèhoun à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis près de 15 ans. Mariée à IMOUROU Fouséni un mécanicien, Rachidatou est mère de quatre enfants. En plus de ses enfants, Rachidatou a un autre enfant à charge. Rachidatou vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Seul le conjoint de Rachidatou supporte les charges de la famille. Rachidatou n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Rachidatou vend depuis près de 35 ans, des divers (savons, omo, pinces, sachets, brosses à dent, dentifrices, stylos, torche, etc.) à son domicile. Rachidatou mène également comme activité secondaire, la vente de nourriture. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Rachidatou s’approvisionne. Rachidatou est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Rachidatou sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé afin d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et d’agrandir son activité, pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Rachidatou R. was born in 1952 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. She has lived in the Cadjèhoun district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for nearly 15 years. Married to Fouséni Imourou, a mechanic, Rachidatou is mother to four children. In addition to her own children, Rachidatou also takes care of another child. Rachidatou lives with her children and husband. Her husband is the only one who takes care of the family's expenses. Rachidatou never went to school. To meet her needs, Rachidatou has sold, for nearly 35 years, various items such as soap, Omo detergent, pliers, sachets, toothbrushes, toothpaste, pens, lamps, etc. at her home. Rachidatou also has a second business in which she sells food items. She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Rachidatou is a long-time client of Alidé who has repaid all of her previous loans. Rachidatou is requesting a third loan through Alidé to increase her working capital and increase the size of her business in order to better meet her customers' needs.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various items (boxes of soap and Omo detergent, toothbrushes, toothpaste, etc.)

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es:
La  Sra. BLANCA se dedica a la venta de golosinas como ser pastelitos, tacos, tajaditas de minimo verde, pollo, refrescos etc. tiene quince años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, Blanca comienza a vender a las cuatro de la tarde, tiene clientes fijos y por la mañana se dedica a la venta de ropa,  como ser venta de pantalones de varon y de dama, blusas, trajes de niño, Blanca vive en la colonia Flor del Campo zona 2 y es una persona sociable, amable y preferida por sus clientes, es conocida en la colonia por su amabilidad, lo cual le ha ayudado a tener buenas ventas. así mismo con sus negocios ha logrado salir adelante con sus hijos ya que su esposo fallecio y no ha tenido mas ayuda que la de su trabajo.
Blanca invierte mernsualmente $1,178.70, y vende $ 1,530.40 obteniendo una utilidad de $351.70. ahora necesita invertir en la compra de ingredientes para la venta de golosinas como ser maseca, pollo, tomates, limones, refrescos y otros ingredientes.
Blanca necesita el credito para salir adelante con su negocio y su hogar.
texts.en:
Blanca sells delicacies like little cakes, tacos, slices of green plantains, chicken, and soft drinks, etc. She has been doing this for 15 years. Blanca starts selling at four in the afternoon. She has regular customers. In the morning she sells clothes like pants for men and women, blouses, and children’s outfits. Blanca lives in the Flor del Campo neighborhood Zone 2. She is a gregarious and kind person, and her customers prefer her. She is known in her neighborhood for her kindness, which has helped her to have good sales. She has been able to get her children ahead through her businesses. Her husband died, and she has not had more help than that of her work. Blanca invests $1,178.70 monthly, and she sells $1,530.40. That gives her a profit of $352.70. She now needs to buy ingredients like corn flour mix, chicken, tomatoes, lemons, soft drinks, and other ingredients. She needs the loan to get ahead with her business and her household.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tortillas, pork, beef, chicken, bananas, shortening, butter, oil, spices, vegetables, salsas, soft drinks, and juice

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Flor Argelia

texts.es:
Flor Es una persona que labora como conserje para alcaldía de Managua. Tiene tres hijos los cuales están en edad escolar y estudian actualmente y es madre soltera. Este cliente ha obtenido dos créditos con CEPRODEL los cuales le han servido en momentos importantes de necesidades como enfermedades de sus hijos y pagos de deudas. Es un excelente  cliente con pagos puntuales. Este crédito otorgado será utilizado para pagar su tarjeta de crédito la cual la tiene en mora.
Es una persona esforzada trabajadora dedicada a su trabajo y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Flor works as a janitor for the city of Managua. She is a single mother with three children who are currently in school. Flor has had two previous loans with CEPRODEL which were utilized for important expenses such as treatment when her children were ill and paying off debts. She is an excellent client who has made her payments on time. This loan will be used to pay her credit card bill which is delinquent. Flor is a hardworking woman who is dedicated to her job and her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay off outstanding credit card debt

loans.name: Dios Proveerá 4, 5, & 6 Group

texts.en:
Andy has a little store where he sells mainly shoes and clothes. He is looK. forward to seeing his business expand and has several objectives which he hopes to achieve with his first loan. First, he is thinK. of buying more merchandise to sell. Then, he is planning to move his business to Las Terrenas’s main street, which is the only paved street in town and, indeed, the one with more economic activity. Finally, he would like to buy a computer which would help make his business steadier. Andy is committed to expanding his business and maK. profits. He would like to buy a car and is dreaming of travelling to the US. He also hopes that he will soon be able to hire an employee to help him carrying out his work.

Andy lives in Las Terrenas, in the rural province of Samana in the Dominican Republic and he is the group coordinator of “Dios Proveerá”. His story and business are representative of the other group members. Thank you for lending to Andy and “Dios Proveerá” group.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise and move the business to a better location

loans.name: Delphine

texts.fr: D. Delphine est née vers 1970 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Delphine vit depuis près de 10 ans à Cadjèhoun à Cotonou. Mariée à KPOKPOLANKPO Iréné un mécanicien auto, Delphine est mère d’un enfant qui est scolarisé. Delphine vit seule avec son enfant et supporte seule les charges de la famille. Delphine n’a fait que le cours primaire. Il y a de cela trois ans que Delphine mène comme activité, la vente de mèches et également de sous vêtements par le système de distribution. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Delphine s’approvisionne. Delphine est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. En vue d’augmenter le stock de ses produits pour pouvoir mieux les faire écouler en période de fêtes de fin d’année, Delphine sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Delphine D. was born around 1970 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Delphine has lived in the Cadjèhoun district of Cotonou for nearly 10 years. Married to Iréné Kpokpolankpo, an auto mechanic, Delphine is mother to one child who is in school. Delphine lives alone with her child and takes care of the family's expenses by herself. Delphine only went to elementary school. For three years, Delphine has sold hair extensions and underwear through the distribution system. She buys her stock at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Delphine is a long-time client of Alidé who has already received two loans through them, loans that she repaid in full. Delphine is requesting a third loan through Alidé so she can buy more stock that she will be able to sell during the end-of-the-year celebrations.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of boxes of hair extensions

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr: H. Jeanne est née en 1965 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Jeanne vit depuis près de 20 ans à Cadjèhoun à Cotonou. Mariée à AKAKOSSI Alexis, un tailleur, Jeanne a en charge trois enfants, dont deux sont ses propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Jeanne vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son conjoint. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Jeanne n’a pas été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Jeanne vend des friperies de façon ambulante. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Jeanne s’approvisionne. Jeanne a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits à ALIDé et qui ont été bien remboursés. Jeanne sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, en vue d’accroître son activité afin de vendre davantage ses articles et de réaliser plus d’économies.
texts.en:
Madame Jeanne H. was born in 1965 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She has lived in Cadjèhoun in Cotonou for nearly 20 years. She is married to Alexis Akakossi who is a tailor. Madame H. has three children in her care, two of whom are her own, and all of them attend school. She lives with her children and her spouse, and together, she and her husband manage the family expenses. Madame H. herself did not go to school. In order to support her and her family's needs, she sells second-hand clothing door-to-door. She stocks up at Dantokpa, Benin's international market. Madame H. has already had two loans from Kiva Field Partner, ALIDé, and both loans have been paid back. She is now requesting a third loan from ALIDé, so that she can grow her business to sell more clothes and thus see greater savings.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothing

loans.name: Rosa Idalia

texts.es:
La sra. Rosa Idalia M., es trabajadora de la alcaldía de Managua. Ella quiere este crédito para mejorar su vivienda ya que ha estado en malas condiciones por lo que requiere mejorarla y darle mejores condiciones de vida a sus dos hijos.

Ella es madre soltera con dos hijos que actualmente estudian en la primaria.

Los dos créditos obtenidos con Ceprodel han sido para solucionar problemas de mejoramiento de vivienda y el crédito solicitado actualmente es para la compra de materiales de construcción.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa Idalia M. works for the city of Managua. She is requesting a home improvement loan because her house is in poor condition. Therefore, she wants to make to make upgrades so that she can provide better living conditions for her children. Rosa is a single mother and her two children currently attend elementary school.

She has obtained two previous from CEPRODEL which have helped on other home improvement projects. The loan she is currently requesting will be used to buy construction materials.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Xochil

texts.es:
La señora Xochil L. C. es una oficinista en la ciudad de Managua. Ella solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la mejora de su vivienda. Pero ella dice también que en momentos de emergencia los utiliza para resolver asuntos importantes como reparación de vivienda y pagos de deudas.

Xochil es madre soltera con tres hijos a su cargo los cuales están en edad escolar. Tiene 2 años de trabajar con CEPRODEL tiempo en el que ha recibido 2 créditos.
texts.en:
Sra. Xochil L. C. works as a clerk for the city of Managua. She is requesting this loan to invest in home improvements. Xochil notes that she has also utilized loans in times of emergency or for resolving major issues such as home repairs or debt payments. She is a single mother with three children attending school. Xochil has been a client of CEPRODEL for two years and has received two previous loans.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Olexander

texts.en:
Olexander is married with a grown daughter. He lives in Kardashinka, in the Kherson region, which is a farming area of Ukraine. Olexander is a farmer. He owns nice, equipped greenhouses and grows agricultural produce for further retail sale. Olexander has been in this business for seven years. Presently, he has 20,000 UAH invested in his venture. His gross income amounts to $2187. 

Olexander is a former military officer. His military experience has helped him stay determined and disciplined which has benefited his business in many ways. Olexander is seeking an 8,000 UAH loan to purchase additional seeds and clear plastic film for his greenhouses. He knows a great deal about farming and greenhouse building which ensures the success of his business and the consistent growth of his profit.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and clear plastic film for covering his greenhouses

loans.name: Renovacion Las Aguilas 1 Y 2 Group

texts.en:
Nieve is the coordinator of the group "Renovacion las aguilas" (Renovation of the Eagles) and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in Santiago where running water is hard to find and electricity is unreliable. Here in Santiago she makes her home as a single mother with three children. 

Nieve Luisa is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her retail business by purchasing clothing, perfume and shoes. She will use the profits to invest in improving her family's living conditions and investing in the future of her children. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy clothes, shoes and perfume to sell

loans.name: Zinaida

texts.en:
Zinaida runs a small business in one of the local stores in Novomoskovsk, next to the central city market, selling children’s clothing items. She is a hard worker. She has worked in this sphere of business for six years and has repaid all previous loans without any problems. Currently, her turnover capital is over $2500. 

Zinaida is constantly looking for new trends and seeking to meet the demands of her customers. This time she is requesting a loan of 5,000 UAH to increase the number of products she has available for sale. She is planning to re-invest new profits in her business to help it run even more efficiently. We believe her managing skills and her ability to choose the right product and to invest lots of hard work and determination in her venture will help Zinaida do big business and become a successful entrepreneur one day.

loans.use: to develop her trade

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is married. She runs her small clothing sales venture in her home town of Melitopol. Yelena owns a vending kiosk in the local central market which is always busy with customers. She has been in business for ten years. Presently, Yelena has $1,250 in gross income. Her monthly net profit amounts to $625.  

Yelena has managed to develop a stable, profitable business based on products that are always in demand. Her business has become the main source of income for her and her family. Yelena’s business is growing. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 UAH to increase her working capital and help boost the further development of her business.

loans.use: to increase her working capital

loans.name: Vitalyi's Group

texts.en:
Vitalyi, married with two daughters, lives in Novomokovsk and earns his living offering cargo transportation services in Ukraine. Vitalyi’s business has been impacted by developments in the farming industry, rich harvests keeping him busy as he travels all around the country with a variety of freight. Vitalyi has been in this sphere of business for two years and his present net profit amounts to 4,700 Grivnyas a month.  

Vitalyi owns two vans and is requesting a loan of 6,000 Grivnyas to do some repair work on his vehicles. Properly operating vans will help him perform his work more efficiently, wasting less fuel and lubricants. Vitalyi is hoping to generate additional income and eventually purchase one more vehicle to further expand his trade.

loans.use: To repair his vehicles

loans.name: Kostya

texts.en:
Kostya is married. He is a businessman from Ivano-Frankivsk where he offers transportation services. He started this business six years ago after he quit working as a driver. This enterprise has been an effective source of income for his family. Currently, his monthly income is about 5,000 Grivnyas.  
 
Kostya is seeking a loan of 12,000 Grivnyas to finish repairs on his vehicle. He wants to paint it and possibly re-sell it to be able to buy a newer, more comfortable car for his business. Kostya works long hours to provide a decent living for his family. He has many challenges in his work. However, he admits he would never go back to being a hired employee, preferring to work for himself.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Ganna

texts.en:
Ganna is a widow. She lives in Vinogradovo and runs her small venture there. She started her business selling cosmetics and perfumes 10 years ago. Low competition and high market demand have enabled rapid growth in the business. Presently, Ganna has about 50,000 Grivnyas in her inventory. Her income amounts to 5,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Ganna is a hard-worker. She has proven to be a prudent borrower, as she never asks for a bigger loan that she can pay back. Lending services in combination with her perseverance, trustworthiness and responsibility have helped to guarantee success in her business. Ganna is seeking a loan of 6,500 Grivnyas to increase her working capital. She would like to purchase assorted cosmetics at wholesale prices to re-sell them in her store. Ganna’s long-term goal is the continued expansion of her business.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics at wholesale prices

loans.name: Rita Esmeralda

texts.es: La joven Rita Esmeralda Martínez , es madre soltera , habita en un barrio del municipio de Ticuantepe , la joven con el primer crédito logro levantar paredes a su vivienda y con este segundo financiamiento quiere poner ventanas y el zinc de la misma , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es su situación económica ya que tiene hijos por mantener y su sueldo no le ajusta para poder realizar la compra de materiales de construcción de una sola vez , sus sueños es poder darle un techo digno a sus hijos para que se sientan seguros y gocen de un mejor bienestar .En los últimos años a pasado por situaciones difícil con sus pequeños por no tener una casa que la cubra del frió y la lluvia ya que el cuarto donde se alberga su mamá con mucho esfuerzo lo construyo de plástico , madera y pedazos de zinc ya muy deteriorados.
texts.en:
Rita Esmeralda Martínez is a young single mother who lives in a poor neighborhood in the town of Ticuantepe. Her first loan was used to build the walls of her house. With this second loan, she will install windows and a zinc roof. Her greatest challenge has been dealing with her financial situation. She has three children to support, yet her salary has not been adjusted in order for her to purchase construction materials all at once. Her dream is to provide a decent home for her children where they can feel secure and enjoy better living conditions. In recent years, she has experienced difficult situations in which her young children were not protected from the cold and the rain. The room currently occupied by her mother is put together with plastic, wood, and sheets of zinc that have greatly deteriorated.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install windows & a zinc roof

loans.name: Geoconda

texts.es:
La señora Gioconda Gutiérrez con muchos esfuerzos logro poner una pulpería  lo hizo con dinero que su esposo dio, el trabaja en una ferretería, procreo cinco hijos de los cuales dos trabajan y tres cursan sus estudios. Tiene 44 años de edad, las dificultades que se le presento es que comenzó a dar crédito y mucha gente no le pago lo que causo quedar con poco en inventario, como alternativa junto con su cuñada 
Pusieron una venta de tortilla lo cual palmean día a día para lograr ingresos y alimentar a su familia, ya que son mujeres emprendedora e independientes. Doña Gioconda desea recoger pronto dinero y poder aumentar productos  ala pulpería. Con este préstamo comprara paca de ropa para vender y atraer a la clientela, ya que mucha gente compra lo mas barato por la crisis del desempleo y por que todo esta mas caro, y no alcanza. Contenta por el apoyo que Afodenic ha dado lo cual espera lograr superar este ciclo en su vida.
texts.en:
With much effort, Gioconda Gutiérrez managed to start a grocery business. Her startup capital came from her husband who works in a hardware store. Gioconda is 44 years old. She and her husband have five children; two are working and three are in school.

The grocery business encountered problems because they extended credit to their customers and many were unable to pay. This left the business with a shortage of inventory. As an alternative source of income, Gioconda then started a tortilla business with her sister-in-law. They pat out tortillas day after day to make an income and feed their families. They are independent and ambitious women.

Gioconda needs this loan to increase the products in her store. She plans to buy a bundle of used clothing to sell. This will attract customers, who are looking for the lowest price because, with the current unemployment crisis and high prices, many are having trouble making ends meet.

Gioconda is pleased with the support given by Afodenic. She hopes this will help her get through this difficult time in her life.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a bundle of used clothing

loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
Benito tiene 36 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y sus cuatro hijos en el sector Cruz del Médano, distrito de Mórrope, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace un año se dedica al negocio de la compra y venta de animales menores. También es agricultor. El nos cuenta que tuvo que incursionar en este negocio debido a que la agricultura no le brindaba los ingresos permanentes que necesitaba para mantener a los suyos. Usualmente recorre los caseríos aledaños comprando patos, pavos, chivos, chanchos y otros animales menores para luego venderlos en la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El negocio ha ido creciendo y el ya tiene vendedores que le proveen de animales cada cierto tiempo, pero desea más capital para ampliar su negocio. Por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para seguir comprando más animales y sacar adelante a su familia.

Su más grande anhelo es seguir creciendo con su negocio de venta de animales y tener su casa propia. Benito es un padre trabajador y responsable.
texts.en:
Benito is 36 years old and is married and lives with his wife and four children in the Cruz del Medano sector in the Mórrope district, located one hour from the city of Chiclayo. For the past year, Benito has been in the business of buying and selling small animals. He is also a farmer. He tells us that he had to start this business because farming was not offer him permanent income needed to maintain his livelihood. He usually runs through the surrounding villages to buy ducks, turkeys, goats, pigs and other small animals and then sells them in the city of Chiclayo. The business has grown, and he already has vendors that provide animals each time, but more capital is needed to expand its business. For this reason, he is asking for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles to continue buying more animals and support his family. His greatest desire is to continue growing his business of selling animals and to have his own home. Benito is a hardworking and responsible father.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of animals to increase sales of his business

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
el sr. Juan O. tiene 60 años de edad, vive en la colonia San Miguel de la ciudad de Tegucigalpa, el se dedica a la venta de condimentos, tiene 14 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad. muchos de sus vecinos son clientes fijos, tambien sale a vender  a lugares fuera de Tegucigalpa, como ser Lamani, Curaren, San Isidro y varios caserios. 
tambien vende su producto por pedidos grandes en diferentes mercaditos, pulperias y cafeterias.
hace ventas al por mayor y al detalle.
el es casado, vive con su esposa y su hijo quien es de gran ayuda para el, ya que salen a vender su producto juntos, son un buen equipo.
Juan necesita el credito para comprar un auto parlante para cuando este pasando por los lugares vaya promocionando sus productos y asi las personas salgan de sus casas para comprarle.
tambien va a comprar un quintal de especias, canela, saborina, curri, achiote, etc.
el necesita el credito para salir adelante con su negocio y su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Juan O. is 60 years old and lives in the San Miguel neighborhood of the city of Tegucigalpa. He has been selling condiments for 14 years. Many of his neighbors are regular customers. Juan also sells in places outside of Tegucigalpa such as Lamani, Curaren, San Isidro, and other villages. He also receives large orders from convenience stores, grocery stores, and cafeterias. His sales are made on a wholesale basis and at retail.

Juan lives with his wife and son, who are a big help to him. They all work selling his products and together they make a great team. Juan is requesting this loan to buy a car for when he travels to different locations promoting his products so that people will leave their houses to come buy them. In addition, he will buy a quintal (46 kg.) of spices such as cinnamon, MSG, curry, annatto, etc. This loan will ensure the success of his business and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a car, a megaphone, and spices to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es una madre de familia de 45 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y tres de sus seis hijos en el sector Manco Cápac, distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicado a 3 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace treinta años se dedica a la comercialización de prendas de vestir junto a su esposo. Adquieren las prendas en las ciudades de Trujillo y Lima y las venden en los mercados de algunos distritos y caseríos cercanos a la zona en donde viven. Este negocio es la única fuente de ingreso del hogar y gracias a él han sacado a sus hijos adelante.

Juana desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más prendas para venderlas durante la temporada navideña. Por este motivo se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Su más grande anhelo es tener su negocio más estable, funcionando dentro de su casa. También quiere terminar de cosntruirla. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado resposabilidad y puntualidad al momento de asumir sus pagos por lo que es considerada un excelente cliente.
texts.en:
Juana is a mother of 45 years of age who lives with her husband and three of their six children in the Manco Capac sector of the Paiján district in the Ascope province in La Libertad region, located 3 hours away from Chiclayo. For thirty years she has been in the business of selling clothes with her husband. They buy clothes in the cities of Trujillo and Lima and sell in the markets of some districts and villages near the area where they live. This business is the only source of household income and thanks to it have helped their children grow and benefit. Juana wants to expand her business in the purchase of more clothes to sell during the holiday season. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1000 nuevos soles to help achieve her goal. Her greatest desire is to have her business become more stable, operating within her home. She also wants to finish constructing her home. She has previously worked with Edpyme Alternativa and has demonstrated responsibility and punctuality in her payments, which is why she is considered an excellent client.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothes for sale during the holiday season

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un padre de familia de 35 años de edad que vive junto a sus siete hijos en el caserío Huaca de Barro, distrito de Mórrope, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Como la mayoría de hombres de la zona se dedica a la agricultura, usualmente siembra maíz y algodón en un pequeño terreno de 0.25 has. También trabaja eventualmente como peón agrícola junto a su esposa.

Debido a que los ingresos con los que cuentan no son permanentes, desde hace un año instaló una pequeña bodega – tienda en su casa. Allí ofrece productos de primera necesidad, abarrotes, golosinas y algunas bebidas con las que puede sustentar a su familia de mejor manera. Manuel desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más bebidas para ofrecérselas a sus clientes. Por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su más grande anhelo es poder ampliar su negocio y dejar gradualmente la agricultura para dedicarse a la ciranza y venta de animales. El es un padre honrado, emprendedor y muy responsable.
texts.en:
Manuel is a 35 year old father who lives with his seven children in the village of Huaca de Barro in the District of Mórrope, which is located one hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

Like most of the men in the area, Manuel is devoted to agriculture. He usually grows corn and cotton on a small plot of 0.25 hectares. In addition, he and his wife work together as hired farm laborers.

Since his family does not earn a steady source of income, he decided to establish a small grocery in his home. He has been in business for a year and offers basic necessities, groceries, candy, and a few beverages in order to provide additional support to his family. Manuel decided to expand his business by buying more beverages to offer to his customers. He is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 soles.

His greatest wish is to gradually stop farming in order to expand his business activities by raising and selling animals. Juan is an honest, enterprising, and responsible father.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more beverages to sell at his store

loans.name: Armin

texts.es:
el sr. Armin F. E. se dedica al negocio de transportar personas, tiene un taxi de punto, el cual hace el recorrido de la Colonia La Vega hacia la Universidad Autonoma de Honduras. tiene 5 años de estar operando en este punto de taxis el cual es muy bueno ya que muchas personas se transportan para la maxima casa de estudios de Honduras.
esta casado y en su casa de habitacion tienen una pulperia y su esposa es la que lleva el control de la misma. juntos salen adelante con los gastos de su familia y los gastos del hogar.
Armin necesita el credito para hacerle mejoras a su vehiculo, cambio de llantas, pintado, reparacion de motor y amortiguadores, esto lo tiene que hacer porque la empresa de revision de taxis exige que las unidades esten en buenas condiciones para dar buen servicio a los clientes que las usan, de lo contrario los dejan sin permiso de operacion.
texts.en:
Armin F. E. is involved in the business of transporting people. He has a fixed route taxi, which covers the route from Colonia La Vega to the Universidad Autónoma de Honduras. He has been operating this route for 5 years, and it is good one because many people travel to the leading academic institution of Honduras.

Armin is married and in their house they have a small grocery store, which his wife manages. Together, they get ahead with the family and household expenses.

Armin needs a loan to make improvements to his taxi – tire change, painting, motor and shock absorber repair. He needs to do this because the taxi inspection company requires that the car be in good condition to provide good service to the customers and if he doesn’t do it, the company will not give him permission to operate.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tires, paint, and spare motor and shock absorber parts

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: María Adela

texts.es:
María tiene 57 años D. edad, es casada y bive junto a su esposo y dos D. sus nueve hijos en el caserío Huaca D. Barro, distrito D. Mórrope, ubicado a una hora D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Ella se dedica a la agricultura desD. muy joven. Junto a su esposo siembra maíz y algodón en algunos terrenos agrícolas cercanos a su vivienda. Durante el tiempo que tienen D. casados ella se ha dedicado a apoyarlo en las labores del campo y a trabajar por el mantenimiento D. su hogar.

Ahora que ya está mayor ella desea seguir ayudando a su esposo pero sin tener que salir al campo a hacer trabajo pesado. Por este motivo ella ha instalado en su casa una pequeña bodega – tienda en la que ofrece a sus clientes y vecinos del lugar artículos D. primera necesidad, así como abarrotes y algunas golosinas.

La necesidad D. esta tienda nació debido a que ellos viven lejos del mercado más cercano y su economía no les permite gastar diariamente pasajes para viajar hacia allá. Por ello la tienda es D. mucha ayuda a sus vecinos. María desea ampliar su negocio con la compra D. más mercadería por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra D. más productos para vender.

María es una mujer alegre, trabajadora y muy amable. Su más granD. anhelo es seguir trabajando por su familia y por su comunidad.
texts.en:
María is 57 years old and married. She lives with her husband and two of her nine sons in the Huaca D. Barro village in the Mórrope district, located an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

She has been involved in agriculture since she was young. Together with her husband, she plants corn and cotton on some of the agricultural lands near their home. During the time that they have been married, she has helped him with the field work and has worked to maintain their home.

Now that she is older, she wants to continue helping her husband but without having to go to the fields to do heavy work. As a result, she has set up a small grocery store in their home – a store in which she offers basic needs items to her customers and neighbors, such as groceries and candies.

The need for the store came about because they live far from the closest market and the economy doesn’t allow for them to spend money on daily trips there. As a result, the store is a great help to their neighbors. María wants to expand her business with the purchase of more merchandise. For this she has asked for her first loan of 1000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa, which she plans to invest in the purchase of more products to sell.

María is a happy, hardworking, and very friendly woman. Her greatest wish is to continue working for her family and for her community.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of more products to expand her business

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela tiene 43 años de edad, es separada desde hace cuatro años y vive junto a sus dos hijas de 14 y 18 años de edad en el sector San Martín de la ciudad de Lambayeque, ubicada a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

La separación de su esposo le motivó a trabajar para ganarse el sustento de sus hijas. Se dedica principalmente a la comercialización de animales: todos los miércoles viaja hacia los caseríos de la zona y compra aves de corral (patos, pavos) que luego vende a los comerciantes de carne del mercado de la ciudad. Ella sacrifica a las aves y las vende listas para ser comercializadas. Este negocio es la principal fuente de ingreso económico de su familia.

De otro lado se dedica a la preparación y venta de vino. Empezó en este negocio hace dos años gracias a que una de sus hijas aprendió el oficio en el colegio donde estudiaba. Marcela fermenta la bebida en baldes de plástico y las ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y conocidos.

Marcela desea ampliar su negocio incursionando en la comercialización de ganado caprino y ovino, pero no cuenta con el capital necesario para lograr su objetivo. Por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una madre que siempre da todo de sí para sacar a sus hijas adelante. La mayor está estudiando ya una carrera técnica. Su más grande anhelo es ver a su dos hijas convertidas en profesionales exitosas. En la fotografía Marcela nos muestra los baldes en donde fermenta el vino que suele comercializar.
texts.en:
Marcela is 43 years old and has been separated for the past four years. She lives together with her two daughters, 14 and 18, in the San Martín sector of the city of Lambayeque, located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

The separation from her husband motivated her to work to earn the means of support for her daughters. She is involved mainly in the animal business: every Wednesday she goes to the farmhouses in the area and buys poultry (ducks, turkeys) which she then sells to the meat shopkeepers in the city market. She sacrifices the birds and sells them ready to be marketed. This business is the main source of income for her family.

On the other side, she is involved in the preparation and sale of wine. She began this business two years ago thanks to the fact that one of her daughters learned the trade in the high school where she studied. Marcela ferments the drink in plastic buckets and sells it to her neighbors and acquaintances.

Marcela wishes to expand her business and enter the goat and sheep market, but she does not have the necessary funds to achieve her goal. As a result, she has seen it necessary to ask for a loan of 1000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa for the first time.

She is a mother that always gives all of herself to help her daughters get ahead. Her oldest is now studying for a technical degree. Her biggest wish is to see her two daughters become successful professionals. In the photo, Marcela shows us the buckets where she ferments the wine that she usually sells.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of more animals to sell

loans.name: Edith Xiomara

texts.es:
la sra. Edith Xiomara A. O. tiene 27 años de edad, vive en la colonia Rivera de la Vega en la ciudad de Tegucigalpa, se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tiene un año de haber iniciado con su negocio, sus clientes son sus vecinos, pulperias, mercaditos, tambien hace tortillas por encargo para reuniones o fiestas.
el credito lo necesita para comparar harina de maiz, leña, cal, agua. desea comprar mas para tener una mayor produccion y asi tener mejores ventas.
nos comento que su sueño es tener una maquina para elaborar tortillas y hacer una mayor produccion ya que este alimento es muy comprado por muchas personas.
texts.en:
Edith Xiomara A. O. is 27 years old and she lives in the Rivera de la Vega neighborhood in the city of Tegucigalpa. She is involved in the production and sale of tortillas and has a year in the business. Her customers are her neighbors, convenience stores, and small markets. She also makes tortillas to order for meetings or parties.

Edith needs the loan to purchase cornmeal, firewood, lime, and water. She would like the purchase more in order to increase production and, thus, have better sales.

She remarked to us that her dream is to have a machine to make tortillas and have increased production since it is a food purchased by many people.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of firewood, cornmeal, water, lime, matches

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
La señora Andrea es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Brisas del Río Blanco” del distrito de Pilcuyo, provincia de El Collao; ella tiene 47 años de edad, es casada,  tiene 05  hijos, 4 de ellos viven con ella  y el mayor tiene pareja, con la que vive aparte. Tiene estudios de primaria incompleta.
Andrea trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 04 años; se dedica a la compra y venta de abarrotes en su casa, además, se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado (cada tres meses).
Nos cuenta que con su primer préstamo que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, compró 2 ovejas de las cuales las crías de estas han sido las ganancias.
Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, el cual invertirá en la compra de 2 toros.
Su visión hacia el futuro es, tener vacas lecheras y ella misma fabricar quesos para luego venderlos.
Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las charlas, además que practican la puntualidad
texts.en:
Andrea, 47, is married and has 5 children, four of whom still live at home with her. Her eldest has a life partner and they live elsewhere. She finished elementary school. She is a member of the "Las Brisas del Río Blanco" (Breezes of White River) communal bank, which is in the Pilcuyo district, El Collao province. She has collaborated with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the last 4 years. She sells groceries from her home and also buys and sells cattle (every three months). She tells us that her first, 300 new sol, loan was used to buy two head of sheep whose young were profits. She now is asking for a 3000 new sol loan to buy two bulls. Her vision for the future is to have dairy cows from whose milk she herself will make cheese to sell. What she likes most about her communal bank are the talks and that they value punctuality.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two bulls.

loans.name: Constantina Maria

texts.es:
La señora Constantina es socia del Banco Comunal “Punta Sahuacasi” desde hace 2 años vive en el  distrito y provincia de Azangaro, tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y madre de 02 hijos. Ella curso el quinto grado de primaria, actualmente se dedica al acopio de leche y al mismo tiempo elabora y vende quesos.

Ella cuenta que el primer préstamo que solicitó fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles con el cual pudo incrementar su capital para poder seguir con su negocio y así poder ofrecer de mejor manera sus productos

Ella requiere un crédito de S/. 700.00 nuevos soles, con el que  aumentará su capital  para comprar una moldeadora de quesos y  así poder ofrecer sus productos a mas clientes.

Su sueño para el futuro es ser distribuidora mayorista y mejorar su planta quesera para poder llegar a más lugares.
Lo que  más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad de las socias y las capacitaciones que recibe.
texts.en:
Constantina, 46, is married and the mother of two children. She finished fifth grade and she is a milk consolidator and cheese maker and seller. She lives in the district and province of Azangaro and has been a member of the "Punta Sahuacasi" communal bank for the past two years. She tells us that her first, 300 new sol, loan was used to increase her working capital so that she could go on with her business and offer her products more efficiently. She now needs 700 new soles to buy a cheese moulder so that she can offer her products to more customers. Her dream for the future is to be a wholesale distributor and to improve her cheese factory so that she can reach more places. What she likes most about her communal bank is the punctuality of the members and the training she receives.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cheese moulder and milk.

loans.name: Lizett

texts.es: Lizett T. es una mujer dinámica y colaboradora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali, tiene 36 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos menores, trabaja confeccionando prendas de vestir (también vende chupetes y  hielo), cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien trabaja como transportista público. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Divinas” desde hace tres años, donde siempre se ha caracterizado por su puntualidad en los pagos. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que le permitió invertir en el arreglo de su refrigeradora para la venta de sus chupetes. En la actualidad ella necesita un crédito de 3000 soles que le permitirá invertir en la compra de telas, hilos y elásticos para confeccionar blusas y luego venderlas a sus clientes. La meta de Lizett es llegar a tener un taller de costura bien implementado y seguir mejorando económicamente.
texts.en:
Lizett T., 36, is a dynamic and cooperative woman that lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She has two minor children. Her line of work is dressmaking (she also sells ice and popsicles). Her husband, who is a public transit driver, supports her efforts. She has been a member of the "Las Divinas" (The Divine Ones) communal bank for the past three years; she has always been noted for her punctuality in her repayments. Her first, 300 sol, loan was used to buy a refrigerator for her popsicle sales business. Currently, she needs 3000 soles to buy fabric, thread and elastic to make blouses to subsequently sell to her customers. Lizett's goal is to have a well-equipped sewing workshop and to continue to improve financially.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread and elastic to sew blouses.

loans.name: Lucía

texts.es:
Lucía H. C., tiene la edad de 60 años, es casada, y tiene 4 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Ella quiere reparar la vivienda para ofrecer un mejor servicio, debido a alquilan parte de la casa y además tienen 2 cabinas para alquilar. Además, tienen una pequeña area de café y un proyecto de palma para aceite. Tiene varios años que se dedica a su finca y quiere crecer.
Ella nunca se ha financiado con FUDECOSUR, y está muy contenta de poder acceder a su primer crédito con la fundación,ya que le brindó mayores facilidades y una tasa de interes accesible. Una vez realizó un crédito con el Banco Popular, pero le solicitaron demasiados requisitos, fue muy tedioso a pesar de que era una tasa de interes muy similar.
Lo que más desea es poder brindarle un mayor bienestar a sus hijos y vivir de una manera más estable
texts.en:
Lucía H. C. is 60 years old, married, and has 4 children who are her first priority. She wants to make repairs to their home to be able to offer better service, as they rent out part of the house and they also have 2 cabins to rent. In addition, they have a small coffee area and a palm oil project. She has had the property for several years and wants it to grow.

She has never been funded by FUDECOSUR, and she is very happy to be able to access her first loan with the foundation since it provides her with greater credit facilities and an affordable interest rate. She once took out a loan with Banco Popular, but they had too many requirements. It was very tedious despite having a very similar interest rate.

What she wants most is to be able to provide a better well being for her children and live in a more stable way.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Housing improvements and repair

loans.name: Amparo Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora AMPARO DEL ROSARIO P. V., tiene 38 años, vive en el distrito de la BUENOS AIRES provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS II. Ella presenta estudios hasta 5to  de secundaria, es conviviente y  tiene 2 hijas quienes dependen económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica al servicio de corte de cabello, ondulaciones, pintado y tambien hace manicure.
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró esmaltes, tijeras y tintes.
Con este crédito de 500.00 nuevos soles comprará cajas de tintes al por mayor para estar abastecida por las  fiestas de fin de año.
Amparo sueña con tener su salon de belleza para así aumentar sus ingresos y poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Señora Amparo Del Rosario P. V. is 38 and lives in the Buenos Aires district in the province of Trujillo in the department of La Libertad in Peru. She is a member of the communal bank, "Mujeres Emprendedoras II" (Enterprising Women II). She studied through her fifth year of secondary school, has a live-in boyfriend, and has 2 daughters who are her economic dependents. She makes a living by cutting hair, doing perms, dying hair, and doing manicures. With her first credit for 300 PEN, she bought nail polish, scissors, and hair dye. With this credit for 500 PEN, she will buy boxes of hair dye wholesale to be supplied for the end-of-year holidays. Amparo dreams about having a beauty salon to be able to increase her income and to be able to offer a better quality of life to her daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy boxes of hair dye wholesale

loans.name: Kathia

texts.es: Kathia Prendes F. tiene la edad de 27 años, es casada, y tiene 3 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Ellos tienen 4, 6 y 9 años respectivamente. Ella quiere mejorar su casa con un corredor que ellos van a construir. Este corredor va a proveer un poco mas comodidad para la familia ya que ayuda ya que el invierno trae problemas con la lluvia. Ella es ama de casa y esta terminando de sacar el bachillerato. Además, su esposo y ella tienen un pequeño finca y él es educador. Es el segundo préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. El primer fue mey excelente por que ayuda a la realizar los tramites y eliminan el gasto.  FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. Ella también tiene el deseo de brindarle a sus hijos la educación necesaria a sus hijo para que puedan crecer y la familia pueda vivir mejor.  Finalmente, ella pertenece al comité de crédito.
texts.en:
Kathia Prendes F. is 27 years old. She is married and has three children who are her biggest priority. Her children are 4, 6, and 9 years old respectively. Kathia wants to make her house better with a corridor that they are going to build. This corridor will provide a little more comfort for the family, who right now have problems with rain in the winter. Kathia is a housewife and is finishing the work to get her diploma. She and her husband have a small farm and he is a teacher. This is the second loan that Kathia has received from FUDECOSUR. The first was very good because it helped her accomplish the arrangements and eliminated the expense. FUDECOSUR offered her a loan with great ease and the interest rate is very low. Kathia also wants to give her children the necessary education so they can grow and the family can live better. Finally, she belongs to a credit committee.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve her housing

loans.name: Nelith

texts.es:
La señora Nelith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Mujeres Talentosas II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 23 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun depende de ella.

Su espíritu luchador, que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de Venta de artesanías, ya que habiendo estudiado cursos de manualidades no dudo en ejercer ese conocimiento e implementar su propio negocio, donde poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en esta actividad. 
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio, ubicado en su misma casa donde vende todo el día también sale  a ofrecer casa por casa los productos que vende  a sus amistades. 
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00, comprará materiales como: pashaca, huairuro, achira, rosarios, mostacillas, todo esto los comprará en kilos. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra una vitrina, donde pueda exhibir sus productos, a sus clientes.
  
Nelith, se siente muy joven, tranquila y contenta con lo que hace  y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Señora Nelith belongs to the communal bank, "Las Mujeres Talentosas II" (Talented Women II) in the district of Tarapoto, in the province of San Martin, in the department of San Martin. She lives with her boyfriend, is 23, and has two children who are her dependents. She has always been characterized by her fighting spirit and her desire to get ahead through her own means. This led her to start her own business selling craftwork, since she had been taking a course in this area, she didn't hesitate in executing this knowledge and starting her own business. Little by little, she made herself known among her customers and today she tells us that it's going very well for her. Currently she is continuing with the same business, which is located in her house where she sells every day. She also goes out to offer her products to friends by going from house to house. With this loan of 800 PEN, she will invest in the purchase of a display case where she can show her products to her customers. Nelith feels very young, calm, and happy with what she does and is thankful to Manuela Ramos for contributing to her fulfilling her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy materials to make her products

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia es una socia dinámica y colaboradora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 44 años, es madre de cuatro hijos, de los cuales dos son mayores de edad. Lidia se dedica a la venta de menús, su esposo la apoya en su negocio, él es vigilante.  Lidia forma parte del Banco Comunal “Juntas hasta el final” desde hace tres años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que invirtió en la compra de una olla arrocera.
Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 800 soles, que será utilizado para comprar mesas y utensilios para vender jugos por las mañanas. La meta de Lidia es tener un restaurante ya que por ahora vende en la vereda de su casa en forma ambulatoria.
texts.en:
Lidia is a dynamic and collaborative member of her community bank, and she lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region of Peru. She is 44 years old and has four children, two of whom are adults. Lidia sells prepared meals and her husband, who is a security guard, supports her in this venture. She has been a member of the communal bank “Juntas hasta el final” (Together to the end) for three years. Her first loan was for 300 soles and she used it to buy a rice cooker. Now she needs a loan of 800 soles to buy tables and utensils in order to sell juices during the mornings. Lidia's goal is to have her own restaurant, as she currently makes her sales in front of her house or as a street vendor.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables and utensils to sell juices

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Elizabeth, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Mujeres Talentosas II”, Distrito Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 26 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Elizabeth, es una mujer joven, trabajadora y luchadora, así que decidió poner su propio negocio de ventas de bebidas gasificadas, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en su misma casa. Es ella quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 250.00 y empezó comprando 05 paquetes de gaseosas, para probar como le va, vio que le iba muy bien y que le falto sus gaseosas, por lo que poco a poco fue invirtiendo mas. En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y ya es conocida por sus clientes que son sus vecinos, familiares y amigos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500.00, comprará más bebidas como: paquetes de gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas, como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas.
 
Elizabeth, tiene muchas metas por delante y se siente muy motivada, así poder hacer realidad  sus sueños y lo que se propone. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando mas lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
Elizabeth belongs to the Communal Bank "Las Mujeres Talentosas II" (Talented Women II), in the Tarapoto District of the Province of San Martín, in the Department of San Martín.
