She is 26 years-old, lives with her partner, and is the mother of 2 children, who depend on her. Elizabeth is a young, hard-working and determined woman and decided to start her own business selling soda drinks in a well-fitted area in her own house. She is the one who administers the business: she makes her own schedule and has no boss. She tells us she began with S/250.00 and first bought 5 packages of sodas to see how it would go. The sales went well, but she ran out of sodas, so little by little she has been investing more. Currently, she is continuing the business, as now she is known by her customers, who are her neighbors, relatives, and friends. With this loan of S/2,500.00 she will purchase more drinks, such as packages of sodas of different flavors, sizes, and brands, as well as mineral water with and without carbonation. Elizabeth has many goals ahead of her and is very motivated, as she knows this is the way to see her dreams realized. She is very grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her when she most needed it. She has always been responsible with her payments, and plans to stay that way.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of packages of soft drinks

loans.name: Gilberth

texts.es: Gilberth R. M. tiene 34 años, casado, y tiene tres hijos que son su primer prioridad. Ellos tienen 12, 7 y 2 años respectivamente y todos viven en la casa. El quiere compar 3 novillos para engorde y vender. Tiene varios años que se dedica a su finca y quiere crecer.  El no tenía problemas en su propiedad, pero si tiene el deseo de sea una finca productiva. Es el segundo préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. También, el ha realizados otros préstamos en bancos estatales como lo es Banco Popular, pero FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. El tiene el deseo de tener una ganancia para darle prosperidad a la familia.
texts.en:
Gilberth R. M. is 34 years old, married, and has three children that are his first priority. They are 12, 7 and 2 years old, respectively, and they all live in his house. He wants to buy 3 young bulls to fatten and sell. For a number of years, he has been dedicated to his farm, and he would like to see it grow. He has not had problems with his property, but he wants it to be a productive farm. This is the second loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. In addition, he has had other loans from state banks like Banco Popular, but FUDECOSUR provided a loan with easier payments and an interest rate that is much lower. He has the desire to make profits to give prosperity to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy young bulls to fatten

loans.name: Lilly

texts.es:
La señora Lilly, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Mujeres Talentosas II”,  Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 33 años y es madre de 03 hijos, los 03 que aun depende de ella. 

Lilly, lleva 10 años dedicándose al negocio, motivada por ella misma y buscando alternativas de generar fuentes de ingresos y gracias a su cualidad de ser una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, le ayudo a iniciarse en la venta de chupetes, nos cuenta que le esta yendo muy bien y poco a poco ha ido ganando clientes. En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo por que ven que el producto que ella ofrece, tiene una buena sazón y sobretodo son atendidos con amabilidad que es lo que a ella le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará ingredientes para la preparación de su producto como azúcar en kilos,  cajas de leche y frutas que a diario necesita para la preparación de los chupetes, a diario cuenta con sus productos surtidos, para así poder captar una mayor clientela. 

Lilly, se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando, y perseverando día a día y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Señora Lilly belongs to the communal bank, "Las Mujeres Talentosas II" (Talented Women II) in the district of Tarapoto, in the province of San Martin, in the department of San Martin. She lives with her boyfriend, is 33, and has 3 children who are all her dependents. Lilly has had her business for 10 years and motivates herself and looks for alternatives of generating sources of income. Thanks to her qualities of being a hard-working and enterprising woman, this has helped her get her start in selling popsicles. She tells us that it is going very well for her and she has earned customers little by little. Currently, she is continuing with the same business, and her customers see that the product she offers has good flavor and above all, she offers friendly service, which characterizes her. With this loan of 1,500 PEN, she will buy ingredients to make her products like sugar by the kilogram, boxes of milk, and fruit. She has a variety of products every day to be able to attract a bigger clientele. Lilly feels very strong to be able to continue working and persevering every day. She is thankful to Manuela Ramos for helping women like her and for having opportunities to develop in their fields.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy ingredients to make her popsicles

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan R. G. tiene la edad de 26 años, es casado y no tiene hijos. Su esposa esta esperando el primer hijo. El quiere comprar dos cortadores de cesped para empezar un negocio a cortar cesped de casas por contracto.  Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no tenía problemas en su propiedad, pero si tiene el deseo de sea una negocio productiva. También, el ha realizados otros préstamos en bancos estatales como lo es el Banco Nacional de Costa Rica, pero  FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. El tiene el deseo a superarse mas al recibir mas ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Juan R. G. is 26, married, and does not have children. His wife is expecting their first child. He wants to buy two lawn mowers to start a contract business mowing lawns for houses. This is the first loan that he has received from Fudecosur. He has not had problems with his property, but he does have the desire to make his business productive. Also, he has had other loans from state banks like the National Bank of Costa Rica. However, Fudecosur gave him a loan with easier payments and much lower interest. He has the wish to improve himself to get more income for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy lawn mowers

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora María Mercedes  Gómez es socia del banco comunal El Arenal,  éste banco está ubicado en  la parroquia Baños al sur de la ciudad de Cuenca, este lugar se caracteriza por sus aguas termales, su gastronomía y la amabilidad de su gente  que atrae al turista nacional y extranjero, nuestra socia vive en la ciudadela La Dolorosa en el sector el Descanso, ella  tiene 52 años de edad, es casada y ha procreado 7 hijos de los cuales los tres primeros son casado y viven independientes mientras que los otros cuatro  viven  con ella y su esposo compartiendo las actividades de la casa y  su negocio, con el esfuerzo conyugal de varios años lograron edificar su casa propia.

María es comerciante de confitería y todo lo relacionado a dulces desde hace quince  años llegando a tener un puesto propio en la feria libre (mercado de Cuenca),  lleva tres años trabajando  con los prestamos que la fundación entrega  éstos ha invertido en su negocio para ir incrementando poco a  poco otras líneas y crecer cada día más,  con el nuevo préstamo que le entreguen va a comprar caramelos, galletas, chocolates y todo para surtir su negocio para la navidad.
texts.en:
María Mercedes Gómez, 52, is a member of the El Arenal communal bank which is located in the Baños parrish in the south side of the city of Cuenca. Cuenca is noted for its thermal waters, its gastronomy and the kindness of its inhabitants which attracts tourists from home and abroad. Our member lives in the La Dolorosa tenement in the El Descanso sector. She is married and has 7 children of which the oldest three are married and living independently and the other four still live with her and her husband sharing household and work chores. With many years of effort typical of a married couple they were able to build their own house. María has been a sweets merchant for the last 15 years and sells everything related to sweets in a stall in Cuenca's marketplace. For the last three years she has been working with loans from the foundation which she has invested in her business helping it to grow little by little, day by day. With the new loan she will buy cookies, candies, chocolates and everything to stock her store for Christmas.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cookies, candies, chocolates, etc. for Christmas.

loans.name: Indira Mabel

texts.es:
Indira  es una de las  socias  del Banco Comunal de Jave Jireh en Portoviejo.  Las socias de éste banco son muy cristianas y dedicadas a sus trabajos.  Portoviejo es la capital provincial de Manabí en la costa de Ecuador.  La provincia es conocida por su  gastronomía (mariscos) y la Ruta del Sol con sus  hermosas playas. Este banco se caracteriza por sus socias muy puntuales con los pagos y  por la seriedad y responsabilidad de cada una de ellas.

Indira tiene  27 años y es madre soltera de dos niños; ella se ha dedicado a estudiar  obteniendo tres títulos universitarios en Técnico Médico, Licenciatura en Lengua y Licenciatura de Liderazgo Educacional, en la mañana trabaja en una escuela para niños especiales y en la tarde atiende en su negocio, manifiesta que tiene doce niños que necesitan su ayuda.
 
El crédito solicitado va a  invertir en su negocio en la compra de materiales didácticos como juguetes y libros para la terapia de los niños para de ésta manera dar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Indira, 27, is a member of the Jave Jireh communal bank in Portoviejo. The members of this group are very Christian and dedicated to their work. Portoviejo is the provincial capital of Manabí on Ecuador's coast. The province is noted for its gastronomy (seafood) and the Route of the Sun with its beautiful beaches. This bank is noted for its very punctual members and for the temperance and responsibility of each one of them. Indira is a single mother of two young children. She has dedicated herself to study and has earned three university degrees: one as a Medical Technician, one as a Bachelor in Language and another Bachelor in Educational Leadership. In the mornings she works at a school for children with special needs and in the afternoons she tends to her business. She states that she has 12 children that need her help. The funding requested will be used to invest in her business buying teaching materials like toys and books to be used in therapy for the children thereby offering better service.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy teaching materials like toys and books.

loans.name: Fanny Maria

texts.es:
La señora Fanny María A. B. es socia del Banco Comunal Artesanal en Jipijapa, ubicado a  una hora de Portoviejo en la provincia de Manabí en la región  costa de Ecuador, esta región es muy conocida por sus hermosas playas, su gastronomía y la amabilidad de su gente cualidades que atraen al turista nacional y extranjero.

Fanny tiene 51 años vive con su esposo y uno de sus hijos que aun es soltero ya que los otros han formado su propia familia y viven independientes,  su cónyuge es obrero en Jipijapa, ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas gaseosas lleva muchos años con éste negocio que lo tiene en su casa propia, aquí  expende colas, cervezas, helados, vino y leche y más.

Este es el tercer préstamo que Fanny solicita a la Fundación ESPOIR con él va a comprar más bebidas como refrescos, gaseosas, cerveza y más para abastecer su negocio.

Su sueño es ir incrementando su negocio para que al momento que ella no pueda trabajar su hijo se haga cargo del mismo.
texts.en:
Fanny María A. B., 51, is a member of the Artesanal communal bank in Jipijapa which is an hour from Portoviejo in the Manabí province along the coast of Ecuador. This region is famous for its beautiful beaches, its gastronomy and for the kindness of its residents, qualities that attract tourists both from home and from abroad. Fanny lives with her husband and one of her sons, who is still single; the others have formed their own families and live independently. Her husband is a laborer in Jipijapa; she sells soft-drinks from her home, an activity that she has been involved in for many years. She sells colas, beers, ice-cream, wine, milk, and more. This is Fanny's third loan request from Fundación ESPOIR and will use it to buy more drinks like beverages, soft-drinks, beer, and more to stock her business. Her dream is to see her business grow enough so that, when the day comes that she can no longer work, her son will take carge of it.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beverages, soft-drinks, beer, etc.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La señora Ana María L. C. es socia del Banco Comunal Picoaza.  Este  banco está conformado por mujeres  de todas las edades.  Picoaza es un pueblito ubicado a diez  minutos al norte de Portoviejo en la provincia de Manabí en la costa de Ecuador, ésta  provincia es  muy  conocida por su gastronomía, las playas y los ceibos (arboles únicos de la región) y ésta localidad no podía ser la excepción pues es un lugar muy comercial, aquí  encontramos muchos  distribuidores de productos agrícolas,  consumo, ropa, etc.

El esposo de  Ana María es conductor de un autobús en Portoviejo, ellos  viven con su  hijo y  un nieto llamado  Wilmer.  Nuestra socia  tiene un pequeño local donde donde funciona una tienda de abarrotes y también prepara comida que vende a sus vecinos y otros comensales del sector, nos indica que empezó este negocio para  ayudar a su familia en estos tiempos difíciles.


Ana María le gusta trabajar con la Fundación ESPOIR por los  beneficios  que ofrece a comparación de sus competidores, manifiesta que la educación  que reciben todas las socias les permite  conocer más sobre  planificación familiar y finanzas  para saber cómo  invertir su dinero. El crédito obtenido va a invertir en su tienda comprando arroz, azúcar, sal, pan y otros productos de primera necesidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana María L. C. is a member of the Picoaza Communal Bank. This communal bank is made up of women of all ages. Picoaza is a small town located ten minutes north of Portoviejo, in the province of Manabi on the coast of Ecuador. This province is well know for its cuisine, its beaches, and ceibo trees (trees unique to this region). This area is not an exception though, and is very commercial: here there are a lot of distributors of agricultural products, consumer goods, clothing, etc. Ana María's husband is a bus driver in Portoviejo. The couple lives with their son and their grandson Wilmer. Our member has a small store where she sells groceries and also prepares food to sell to neighbors and other people from the area. She tells us she started this business to help her family during these difficult times. Ana María likes to work with Fundación ESPOIR because of the benefits it offers compared to its competitors. She says the education that all the members receive teaches them more about family planning and finance, and how to invest their money. The funds from this loan will be invested in the business through the purchase of rice, sugar, salt, bread, and other basic products.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, salt, bread, and other basic products for retail sale.

loans.name: Rossana

texts.es: Rossana R.  es una mujer dinámica y colaboradora, vive n la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 40 años de edad, madre de dos hijos menores, se dedica a  la confección de prendas de vestir, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es  mecánico. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Margaritas” desde hace seis años, donde siempre se ha caracterizado por su puntualidad en sus pagos. El primer crédito que recibió le permitió invertir en la compra de prendas interiores para luego venderlos. En la actualidad ella necesita un crédito de 1200 soles que le permitirá invertir en telas, hilos, elásticos para confeccionar blusas y todo tipo de prendas de vestir para venderlas a sus clientes. La meta de Rossana es llegar a tener un taller de costura bien implementado y seguir mejorando económicamente.
texts.en:
Rossana R. is a dynamic and collaborative woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 40, is the mother of 2 young children, and makes a living by making clothing. She has the support of her husband, who is a mechanic. She has been a member of the communal bank, "'Las Margaritas" (The Daisies) for 6 years, where she has always been characterized by being punctual with her payments. The first credit she received allowed her to invest in the purchase of undergarments to later sell. Currently she needs a loan of 1,200 PEN which will let her invest in the purchase of fabric, thread, and elastic to make blouses and all types of garments to sell to her customers. Rossana's goal is to have a sewing shop that is well-implemented so she can continue improving economically.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will invest in the purchase of fabric, thread, and elastic to make clothing.

loans.name: Blanca Cecilia

texts.es:
Blanca P. es socia del banco comunal El Arenal, vive en el barrio la Calera en la parroquia Baños al sur de la ciudad de Cuenca, éste lugar se caracteriza por sus atractivos turísticos como sus aguas termales, su gastronomía  sobre todo las papas con cuy, nuestra socia  tiene 31 años de edad, se encuentra casada y madre de dos hijos uno de 14 y 8 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio Daniel Córdova y su último hijo  en la escuela Rincón del Saber unidades educativas de la localidad, su esposo como la mayoría de hombres de la región azuaya emigró al exterior  en busca de un futuro mejor para su familia y gracias  al esfuerzo de su trabajo construyeron su casa propia.

Blanca trabaja en su tienda  de abarrotes desde seis años, su horario de atención es de 6 a.m. a 8 p.m. todos los días en forma ininterrumpida, nos comenta que la ventaja de tener su propio  negocio es ser dueño de su tiempo, ya que si necesita hacer algunas gestiones sólo la cierra y listo.

Este es su ciclo 16 trabajando con los prestamos de la fundación beneficiándose tanto en  su negocio como en su hogar, con el nuevo crédito va a  comprar arroz, azúcar, sal, aceite y más productos de primera necesidad para abastecer su tienda con todo lo necesario e ir incrementando su negocio poco a poco.

Su meta es terminar su casa.
texts.en:
Blanca P. is a member of the Communal Bank “El Arenal” (The Sandbox). She lives in the neighborhood of La Calera in the Baños Parrish of southern Cuenca. This area is known for its tourist attractions (such as the thermal springs) and the local cuisine containing guinea pig and all types of potatoes. Blanca is 31 years old, married, and the mother of two children (ages 14 and 8). Her older child is a student at Daniel Córdova High School, while the younger one attends the Rincón del Saber School. Like most men from this region, Blanca’s husband moved abroad in search of a better future for his family. Thanks to his hard work, they will be able to build their own house.

Blanca works at the grocery store she started six years ago. She is open from 6am to 8pm every day without interruption. The advantage of having her own business is being in control of her own schedule. If she needs time to manage issues away from the store, then she can close the business until she is ready to reopen.

Blanca is working on her 16th loan cycle with the Foundation. Her previous loans have benefitted her home, as well as her business. With this new loan, she will buy rice, sugar, salt, oil, and other basic necessities to restock her store and enable her business to grow slowly. Blanca’s goal is to finish the construction of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic necessities to restock her store

loans.name: Genesis Group

texts.es:
En uno de los Centros Focales más alejados de Pro Mujer Collpani, se reúnen cada dos semanas la Asociación Comunal Genesis, llevan adelante su reunión liderizadas por su presidenta  María Angélica Beltrán, este grupo tiene 15 integrantes  y todas tienen diversos negocios como ser: atención de chapería ( arreglo de autos),  llamadas telefónicas, juegos en red, servicio de transporte, lavado de autos, atención de tienda de barrio, venta de muebles, zapatos, plásticos, comida, productos de limpieza y costura de prendas de vestir.
Todas necesitan el préstamo para adquirir mercadería, en el caso de negocios de comercialización, comprar activo fijo en el caso de negocios de servicios y material de trabajo en el caso de negocios de producción.
Genesis están juntas hace aproximadamente 5 años y desean seguir con la familia de Pro Mujer por mucho tiempo.
texts.en:
In one of the most remote regional offices of Pro Mujer Collpani, la Asociación Comunal Genesis meets every two weeks. The meeting is led by President María Angélica Beltrán. This group has 15 members and everyone has diverse businesses like: auto body work (auto repair), phone call services, internet games, transportation services, car washes, neighborhood stores, the sale of furniture, shoes, plastic items, food, and cleaning products and sewing. They all need this loan to purchase merchandise for the commercial businesses, to buy fixed assets for the service based businesses and work materials for production based businesses. Genesis has been together for approximately 5 years and the group wants to continue together with the Pro Mujer family for a long time.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of merchandise, fixed assets and work materials

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La señora TERESA G. C., tiene 45 años, vive en el distrito del Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal SEMILLITAS CREATIVAS.
Ella presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria, tiene 3 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella. TERESA se dedica a la fabricación y perfilado de calzado en un pequeño taller que tiene con su tío en su domicilio.
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles, compró materiales para la fabricación de sus zapatos, sandalias, zapatillas y carteras como: cuero, plantas, cuerina, plantilla, hebillas, etc. 
Con este crédito de 1,000 nuevos soles comprará cuero, plantillas, pegamento, hilos, etc. 
Teresa sueña con tener su propio stand en un centro comercial de Trujillo en donde vender su calzado al por mayor y menor.
texts.en:
Mrs. Teresa G. C. is 45 years old and lives in the district of Porvenir, in the Trujillo province which is part of the La Libertad region of Peru. She belongs to the communal bank “Semillitas Creativas” (Creative Little Seeds). She attended school through grade 11 and has 3 dependent children. Along with her uncle, Teresa designs and manufactures footwear in a small workshop in her home. With her first loan of 300 Nuevos Soles, she bought materials such as leather, soles, suede, insoles, buckles etc. in order to make shoes, sandals, slippers and handbags. With this loan of 1000 Nuevos Soles, she hopes to purchase leather, insoles, glue, thread etc. Teresa dreams of having her own booth at a shopping center where she can sell shoes wholesale and retail.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase leather, insoles, glue etc.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es:
La Señora  Celestina  es socia del Banco Comunal “Punta Sahuacasi” del distrito y Provincia de Azangaro es  casada y madre de 04 hijos, tiene 52 años de edad y viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 01 año, estudió hasta el cuarto grado de Primaria.

Celestina se dedica a la confección de  tejidos a punto, con el cual  trabaja y puede apoyar a sus hijos que están estudiando. Al mismo tiempo trabaja por las tardes en el Terminal de Azangaro.

El primer préstamo que solicito fue de S/. 500.00, el cual invirtió en la compra de lana de diversos colores y materiales para poder seguir trabajando.

Ella requiere un crédito de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, el cual invertirá en la compra de  productos como: lana de alpaca, para poder seguir tejiendo y vender sus productos en estas fiestas navideñas. 

Su mayor sueño es  que sus hijos sean profesionales.

Lo que  mas le gusta  de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y las charlas que dan.
texts.en:
Celestina is a member of the “Punta Sahuacasi” Communal Bank in the district and province of Azangaro. She is 52 years old, married, and the mother of 4 children. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos organization for one year, and has a fourth-grade education. Celestina earns a living making knitted handicrafts, which helps her to support her children, who are currently in school. At the same time, she also works at the Azangaro bus terminal in the afternoons. The first loan that she requested was for 500.00 soles, which she invested in the purchase of several colors of wool and materials so that she could keep working. She now needs a loan of 1000.00 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of products such as alpaca wool—this will allow her to keep knitting and selling her products during the Christmas season. Celestina’s big dream is for her children to become professionals. She likes her communal bank because of the punctuality and because of the lectures that are given there.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing wool, dye, etc.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
La señora Marleny, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Estrellitas II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 28 años  y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Su carácter y su anhelo de cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes con cuyas ganancias aportaría al ingreso económico en su hogar, desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes. Se encuentra ubicada en el Mercado “El Huequito”. Hoy en día cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su puesto a comprar, porque en ella  encuentran todo los productos que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,300.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos; galletas, fideos y sales en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Marleny, se siente muy bien para continuar trabajando y esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela R. por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marleny belongs to the communal bank “Las Estrellitas II” (Little Stars II) in the Tarapoto district of the San Martin province and region. She is single, 28 years old and mother of two dependent children. Her nature and wish to achieve her dreams motivated her to start her own business selling groceries. With the profits she is able to contribute to the economic growth of her household. From the get go she has been gaining customers. The business is located in the El Huequito market. These days she can rely on her regular customers who purchase from her daily because they know they will find all the products that they need while receiving charismatic personal attention. With the loan of 1300 Nuevos Soles, she will buy sacks of rice and sugar, cookies, noodles, packages of salt, milk and tins of fish of various types, crates of eggs and personal hygiene items in order to continue to provide better customer service. Marleny feels good about her work and is very grateful to the Manuela R. Movement for helping women like her have the opportunity to develop in the areas in which they work.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase groceries in order to increase products

loans.name: Irela  Rosa

texts.es: La Señora Irela L.  es una persona que labora a la Alcaldía de Managua como Secretaria. Tiene un hijo  no está en edad escolar. Este cliente ha obtenido dos créditos con CEPRODEL los cuales le han servido para resolver pagos de tarjetas de créditos que actualmente estaba en mora. Es un excelente  cliente con pagos puntuales. Es una persona trabajadora y puntual en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Irela L. works as a secretary for the mayor’s office in Managua. She has a child who is too young for school. She has had two loans with Ceprodel, which she used to pay her credit cards. They were delinquent. She is an excellent client with punctual payments. She is hard-working and punctual with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay past due credit cards

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Doña Lucia tiene 46 años de edad, se casó a los 24 años y es madre de 03 hijos (02 varones, 01 mujer), estudió primaria completa, vive en el Distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno.

Desde hace 02 años integra el Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazaret” con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles, aumentó a su capital y compró 01 ganado vacuno, ella se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de ganado vacuno conjuntamente con su esposo, adquiere el ganado en las ferias de Ilave y vende en el Centro Poblado de López.

Para seguir aumentando más capital, solicitará un nuevo crédito de 2,500.00 nuevos soles, tiene planificado comprar 01 ganado vacuno mejorado.

Su sueño es que sus hijos estudien y que su negocio pueda crecer más.
texts.en:
Doña Lucia is 46 years old and has been married for 24 years. She is the mother of three children, two sons and a daughter. Lucia has an elementary school education and lives in the District of Ilave, El Collao Province, Department of Puno.

She became a member of the Jesus of Nazareth Communal Bank two years ago. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to increase her capital so that she could buy one head of cattle. She buys and sells livestock along with her husband. Lucia acquires her animals at the fairs in Ilave and sells them in the central village of López.

To continue increasing her capital, she is requesting a new loan of 2500 soles and plans to purchase one head of cattle that is of much better breed.

Lucia hopes that her children will continue their studies and that her business grows even more.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cattle of better breed

loans.name: Azucenas Group

texts.es:
Venta de verduras, libros, ropa interior, dulces, pollos, plásticos y transporte, son los diversos negocios a los cuales se dedican las integrantes del grupo Azucenas, que a su vez  pertenecen al Centro Focal Collpani, que se reúnen cada dos semanas. Todas trabajan  con mucho entusiasmo para sacar adelante a sus familias para tener una mejor calidad de vida,  están juntas hace aproximadamente  4 años y les gusta participar de las capacitaciones, también  realizaron visitas a el consultorio llevando a sus hijos para el control de peso y talla.
Todas necesitan acceder al préstamo para incrementar capital de trabajo en su mayoría piensan comprar mercadería.
texts.en:
The members of the group “Azucenas” (Lilies) have different retail businesses selling vegetables, books, undergarments, candy, plastics, as well as providing transportation services. Every two weeks, they meet at the Collpani Community Center. They all work with great enthusiasm so that they can succeed on behalf of their families and provide them with a better quality of life.

The members have been working together for approximately four years. They have also brought their children to the health clinic so that their children’s height and weight can be monitored. In order to increase their working capital, the members are requesting a loan to buy merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for their respective businesses

loans.name: Lita

texts.es:
La señora Lita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Estrellitas II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín,  Es Soltera, tiene 42 años y 01 hijo independiente.

Lita, lleva 10 años dedicándose a la confección de vestidos, ya que teniendo conocimiento en este tipo de actividad, no dudo en implementar su propio taller de costura, ubicada en su misma casa, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, donde diariamente atiende a sus clientes fijos, que ya la conocen y necesitan el servicio. Lita, trabaja con pedidos que con anticipación sus clientes le solicitan. En la actualidad, Lita esta muy contenta y orgullosa por lo logrado. 

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,400.00, comprará telas en metros, de diferentes especies y colores, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, hilos en carretes grande y de variados colores, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones. 

Hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Sra. Lita is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Estrellitas II” (Little Stars II), which is located in the District of Tarapoto, San Martín Province, Department of San San Martín. She is 42 years old, single, and the mother of an adult child.

Lita has worked as a seamstress for 10 years. Using her knowledge and sewing experience, Lita did not hesitate to start her own dressmaking shop that she operates out of her home. Her business is well-suited for welcoming her regular customers, who come by on a daily basis in need of her services. Lita's work is based on the orders that her customers submit in advance. She is very happy and proud of what she has achieved.

With this loan of 1400 soles, Lita will buy meters of fabric in different styles and colors, scissors, large spools of thread in different colors, hand sewing needles, sewing machine needles, pins, and buttons. Today Lita feels that she is an accomplished woman. She now has even more desire to achieve and fulfill her other dreams. Lita is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and supporting other women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sewing materials & supplies

loans.name: Emilce

texts.en:
Emilce S. is 33 and married to Lopez Tranquilino, a professional mechanic, with whom she has two sons, aged 13 and 7 years.
About six years ago, Emilce decided to open an ice cream stall in her neighborhood. She needed to make some money because her family was going through a very difficult time financially. She decided to expand her stall to include other merchandise also. 
Now Emilce has a pantry fully stocked with a variety of goods. Thanks to her business, she was able to buy a small van to transport the goods she buys from her local market, thus avoiding delivery costs. She hopes to continue expanding her business and working with the Fundacion Paraguaya.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys tiene 48 años, vive con su madre y sus dos hijos adolescentes.
Desde muy joven incursionó en varios oficios para sacar a su familia adelante, actualmente se viene dedicando a su salón de belleza. Con mucho esfuerzo, Gladys logró implementar un espacio de su vivienda para su negocio. Desde entonces atiende a sus asiduos clientes, en su mayoría mujeres, quienes frecuentan mucho su local, pues Gladys es muy carismática y trata muy bien a su clientela, aconsejándolas y conversando con ellas cuando vienen a atenderse, y en algunas oportunidades su madre la apoya como su asistente. 
Para el futuro, Gladys desea seguir extendiendo su negocio y así lograr mejores ingresos para el bienestar de su familia. 

Este es su décimo préstamo con MFP, ella es considerada una cliente muy responsable, puesto que paga a tiempo todas sus cuotas. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de productos necesarios para su salón, además equiparlo para hacerlo más cómodo a la clientela.
texts.en:
Gladys is 48 years-old and lives with her mother and her two adolescent children. From a very young age Gladys worked various jobs to care for her family. Currently, she has a beauty salon. With a lot of effort, Gladys succeeded in creating a space for the business in her home, and since then she has been attending her regular customers, mostly women, who come often to her salon. Gladys is very charismatic and provides great service to her customers, giving them advice and chatting with them when they come in. Sometimes her mother helps her as an assistant. In the future, Gladys wishes to continue expanding her business and thus earn more income for the benefit of her family. This is Gladys' tenth loan with MFP. She is considered a very responsible client, as she has always made her payments on time. With the funds from this loan she will purchase more products she needs for the salon, and also make it more comfortable for her clientele.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products and equipment for her salon.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Felipa es una mujer muy trabajadora de 34 años, comparte su vida con Dilmer, su esposo, con quien vive en su casa propia al lado de sus 3 hijos: Verónica de 26, Jonathan de 23 y Jacky de 22 años.

Felipa ha realizado variedad de trabajos, pero desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de artículos por temporada, siendo muy responsable con su trabajo, ya que si bien debe atender las labores del hogar, también tiene horarios establecidos para realizar sus ventas. 
Actualmente se encuentra ofreciendo bolsas pláticas de reconocidas marcas, vendiéndolas en los mercados, teniendo mayor demanda en los puestos ropa, por lo que le resulta un negocio muy rentable. 
Felipa está muy contenta con su negocio y para el futuro desea implementar una bodega en su vivienda, es por ello que trabaja muy duro y ahorra las ganancias que obtiene para hacer realidad su objetivo.

Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP y siempre ha sido una cliente muy puntual en todos sus pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mayor cantidad de bolsas para aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Felipa is a hard-working, 34-year-old woman who lives with her life partner, her husband Dilmer, in their own house, alongside their 3 children: Veronica (26), Jonathan (23), and Jacky (22). Felipa has worked a variety of jobs, but a year ago she began selling seasonal products. She is very responsible with the business, as she carefully splits her time between household tasks and an established schedule to sell her merchandise. Currently she is selling plastic bags of recognizable brands. She sells them in the markets, where there is a greater demand for them in the clothing stands, and the business is very profitable. Felipa is very happy with her business and in the future wishes to install a convenience store in her home. She works very hard and saves her earnings to make this dream a reality. This is Felipa's fifth loan with MFP. She has always been a good client and been very punctual in making her payments. The funds from this loan will be invested in the purchase of a greater quantity of bags in order to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of more merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Zeudi

texts.es:
Zeudi, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Estrellitas II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 33 años y es madre de 02 hijos, los 02 que aun dependen de ella.

Zeudi, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de limones y con la seguridad y optimismo que siempre le ha caracterizado, por iniciativa propia implemento su propio negocio de venta de golosinas, ubicada en su misma casa, un local muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes. Lleva poco tiempo en el negocio y esta muy contenta con lo logrado, ya que le va muy bien.

En la actualidad, cuenta con una clientela ya fidelizada, siendo sus principales clientes los mismos trabajadores de la Municipalidad,  que a diario acuden a su puesto, donde ella los atiende con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará golosinas como: paquetes de galletas en diferentes sabores, keres, chifles en docenas, chocolates como: cañonazos, sublimes,  para aumentar sus productos y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Zeudi, esta preparada para todo y aun se siente con muchas fuerzas para continuar trabajando y seguir adelante. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Zeudi, 33, is a member of the "Las Estrellitas II" communal bank which is in the Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She lives with her life partner and her two children, both of whom depend on her. She used to sell lemons but, with her usual optimism and self-assuredness, through her own initiative, decided to set up her own sweets and snack shop in her home where she has a well-equipped area in which to take care of customers. She's been in this line of work for a short time but is happy with what she has accomplished since she does quite well. She has regular customers that she can count on; they are, for the most part, municipal employees that visit her daily where she takes care of them with her typical charisma. With this 2000 sol loan she plans to buy an assortment of popular snacks and sweets to increase her stock inventory and provide better service to her customers. Zeudi is prepared for everything and still feels very strong to continue working and getting ahead. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her to meet her goals and dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sweets and snacks.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.es:
Abraham es un hombre trabajador de 60 años, vive solo en la casa que con tanto trabajo logró edificar.

Él se dedica, justamente a eso, a la construcción de casas, desde que era pequeño su padre le enseñó esta labor y todos los secretos para lograr una buena edificación y con el pasar del tiempo, la experiencia le hizo ser experto y ahora puede leer planos y trabajar por contrato.
A Abraham le gusta mucho su trabajo y todos estos años lo ha realizado con mucha alegría y orgullo, pero sabe que no podrá estar en esta actividad para siempre, es por ello que para el futuro ha pensado implementar una ferretería, pues es un negocio más estable y tranquilo que podrá administrar desde su casa. 

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy responsable y puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el dinero que solicita comprará algunas herramientas que le hacen falta para mejorar su trabajo en la construcción y así brindar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Abraham is a hard-working, 60-year-old man. He lives alone in his home that he worked very hard to build. He makes a living by doing just that, building homes. His father taught him to do this starting when he was very young, and he taught him all the secrets to building good and long-lasting homes. Experience has made him an expert and now he can read plans and work by contract. Abraham likes his job a lot, and in all of these years, he has done it with a lot of happiness and pride. But he knows he won't be able to do this work forever, and that is why he has thought about implementing a hardware store in the future. It is a stable and calm business that he will be able to manage from his home. This is his second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and he has always been characterized by being a very responsable and punctual person with his payments. With the money that he is requesting, he will buy some tools that he needs to improve his construction work so he can offer better service.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Suma Pacha Group

texts.es: Donata M. de 53 años  hace 13 años emprendió el negocio de venta de frescos/gaseosas, con mucho esfuerzo logro tener un lugar de venta en la Ceja de la Ciudad de El Alto,  donde vende  cuatro días a la semana desde las 9:30 hasta la 16:00, ella tiene 7 hijos 6 de los cuales son independientes y solamente la menor está  a cargo de ella. A Donata le gusta vender y es la única fuente de ingreso por lo que ahora necesita el préstamo para comprar la kisa (durazno seco) insumo con el cual prepara los frescos, quiere comprar un kintal. A Donata le agrada la capacitación que se imparte en Pro Mujer porque es una oportunidad para aprender, también la atención que brindan en Salud. Sus compañeras al igual que Donata tienen actividades económicas diversas como la venta de carne de cordero, limpieza de ropa, venta de accesorios de belleza, transporte, venta de reloj y venta de comida. Todas necesitan el préstamo para incrementar capital de trabajo a sus negocios.
texts.en:
Donata M., 53, started selling soft-drinks 13 years ago. Through much effort she managed to secure a spot to sell in La Ceja (main commercial thoroughfare) in the city of El Alto where she works four days a week from 9:30-16:00 hours. She has 7 children 6 of which are independent; she only has one minor left at home who is dependent on her. Donata loves selling and this is her only source of income. She needs financing to buy kisa (dehydrated peach), an ingredient used to prepare juices; she wants to buy a quintal (a weight measure equal to 46 kilos.) Donata likes the training sessions that Pro Mujer imparts because they are an opportunity to learn; she also appreciates the health services they offer. Her fellow members, like Donata, have different economic activities like the sale of lamb meat, laundry sevices, sale of beauty accessories, transportation, watch sales, and prepared meal sales. They all need financing to increase their working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital increase.

loans.name: Kuñakuera Katupyry Group

texts.en:
This Women's Entrepreneurial Committee uses their loans to purchase clothing, beverages, meats, sausages, breads, herb, oil, sweets, vegetables, fruits, ingredients for pastries and baked goods, confectionery, dairy, haberdashery, sewing items, yarns, fabrics, scissors, vegetables, fruit, cleaning supplies, etc.

Maria Elizabeth M. sells milk, investing her loan to buy better feed for her cows, so she can have higher quality and more milk and offer more to her customers. 

Hilaria D. has a pantry, and has invested her loan in the purchase of general merchandise such as sugar, herbs, milk, beverages, etc. so that she can offer good variety of merchandise to her customers. 

Maria M. S. sells clothes and is investing her loan to buy a greater variety to satisfy the demands of her customers. 

Francisca Teresa A. is dedicated to the sale of beverages, investing her loan to buy  drinks in bulk, to be able to offer a variety of cold drinks to her customers. 

Gilda B. sells food, investing her loan in buying ingredients to offer her patrons a better variety of food and more diverse menus. 

Silvia Ramon O. has a pantry, so invests her loan to purchase more merchandise to have greater variety to goods to sell.

Birin A. D. R. sells milk, investing her loan to buy better feed for her cows, so she can have higher quality and more milk and offer more to her customers. 

Isidora M. M. sells ice cream, and is using her loan to invest to buy more ice cream and other products such as beverages and candy to sell along siD.. 

Antonia G. R. has a pantry, so invests her loan to purchase more merchandise to have greater variety to goods to sell.

Mirna C. D. C. sells food, investing her loan in buying ingredients to offer her patrons a better variety of food and more diverse menus. 

Rosa Estela F. sells vegetables, investing her loan to buy vegetables wholesale to make a greater profit. 

Graciela F. Concepcion sells clothing, investing her loan to buy a greater variety for different seasons to satisfy the demands of her customers. 

B. C. Carolina sells clothing, investing her loan to buy a greater variety for different seasons to satisfy the demands of her customers. 

Marilena Espinola D. F. sells food, investing her loan in buying ingredients to offer her patrons a better variety of food and more diverse menus.  

Denise Maciel Barreto sells food, investing her loan in buying ingredients to offer her patrons a better variety of food and more diverse menus.  

Monica R. sells food, investing her loan in buying ingredients to offer her patrons a better variety of food and more diverse menus.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to resell

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 41 años, vive con su esposa (Victoria), de 32 años, y con sus 5 hijos: Diana de 12, Carlos de 10, Joseph de 8, Jerson de 5 e Ismael de 3 añitos, en su casa propia.

Desde hace 10 años él se dedica a brindar servicio de taxi, pues aprendió a conducir muy joven y le gusta mucho esta actividad. Es por ello que se decidió por este negocio para poder solventar los gastos de su hogar, lo que le resulta muy rentable, pues tiene buena cantidad de clientes, quienes solicitan de su servicio para poder llegar a su destino. 
Sin embargo, para Carlos su trabajo trae consigo muchos peligros, ya que ha sabido de casos que ladrones abordan los carros y terminan por robar el vehículo, felizmente hasta el momento él no ha tenido ningún percance. 
Para el  futuro, desea tener un negocio más estable como una bodega que pueda instalar en su vivieran, además de comprar su vehículo propio, pues el que tiene lo alquila.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que promete ser muy puntual en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita empezará a comprar algunos estantes para su futura tienda y así lograr que su meta sea pronto una realidad.
texts.en:
41-year old Carlos lives in his own house with his 32-year old wife Victoria and their five children: Diana (12 years old), Carlos (10), Joseph (8), Jerson (5), and Ismael (3). For ten years he has offered a taxi service; he learned to drive when he was very young and as he really enjoys driving, he decided to enter this line of work to earn money to pay for household expenses. It has turned out to be a profitable venture as he has a lot of customers who seek him out to take them to their destination. However, his line of work carries with it many dangers; there have been cases when thieves have got into cars and stolen them. Luckily, as of now, Carlos has never had an incident. In the future Carlos would like to have a more stable business like a corner store that he could run out of his home. He also wants to buy a vehicle of his own as the one he has at the moment is rented. This is his first loan with Kiva partner MFP, and he promises to be punctual with his repayments. With the money he will start buying shelving for his future store and in this way ensure that his goal soon becomes reality.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: investment in his future shop

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 37 años, vive con José, su esposo de 65 años, y con sus 5 hijos: Corali de 20, los gemelos Juan José y Ricardo de 18 y las gemelas Bonnie y Cinti de 15 años de edad.

Desde hace 15 años tiene una renovadora de calzado, negocio que instaló junto con su esposo, ya que él tiene experiencia en este oficio, ellos trabajan incansablemente durante todo el día para poder lograr los ingresos necesarios y mantener a su numerosa familia. 
Debido a que vienen realizando esta labor durante muchos años no le es complicado, pero a veces es agotador, aun así ellos trabajan muy duro para conseguir sus tan ansiados sueños de implementar una librería-bazar cerca de su domicilio, pues esa zona es muy comercial y dentro de poco se construirán hospitales y eso favorecerá la concurrencia de gente. 

Este es su segundo crédito individual con MFP, anteriormente fue parte de un banco comunal y siempre ha sido muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará material e insumos para su negocio y así seguir arreglando y elaborando zapatos de la mejor manera.
texts.en:
37-year old Juana lives with her 65-year old husband José and their five children: Corali (20 years old), twins Juan José and Ricardo (18), and twins Bonnie and Cinti (15). For fifteen years she has run a shoe-mending business along with her husband who has experience in this line of work. They work tirelessly the whole day in order to earn enough money to support their large family. Because they’ve been doing this work for many years, they don’t find it difficult, but at times it is exhausting. For this reason they are working very hard to achieve their long-held dream of opening a bookstore near their home. They live in a commercial part of town where new hospitals are soon going to be built which will bring in more people. This is Juana’s second individual loan with Kiva partner MFP. She was formerly a member of a communal bank and has always been very punctual repaying the money she owed. With the money she is now asking for, she will buy material and supplies for for her business so she can continue mending and making shoes in the best possible way.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy material

loans.name: Mujeres Virtuosas Group

texts.en:
This Women's Entrepreneurship Committee will use their loan to buy meat, pies, bakery, vegetables, napkins, vegetables, coal, oil, rowers, divers, jackets, trousers, blouses, fruits, cell phone accessories, lingerie, candy, jewelry, soft drinks, beer, plastic storage containers, etc. 

Alejandra E. sells food, investing her loan in buying ingredients to offer her patrons a better variety of food and more diverse menus.  
  
Angela B. sells clothing, investing her loan to buy a greater variety for different seasons to satisfy the demands of her customers.

Clotilde D. sells clothing, investing her loan to buy a greater variety for different seasons to satisfy the demands of her customers such as shirts, jackets, trousers, blouses, etc. 

Jacquelin Chaves sells fruit and invested her loan to buy various wholesale fruit for later sale for greater profit. 

M. Innocence sells fruit and invested her loan to buy various wholesale fruit for later sale for greater profit. 

Marisol C. sells food, investing her loan in buying ingredients to offer her patrons a better variety of food and more diverse menus.  

Isabel F. sells cellular accessories and invested her loan to purchase various goods for re-sale. 

Francisca V. sells lingerie and invests her loan to buy more and higher quality products. 

Maria Luisa F. sells candy and invests her loan to purchase goods for sale. 

Eugenia F. is dedicated to the sale of drinks and spent the money on buying drinks in bulk for subsequent sale 

Inocencia B. sells cellular accessories and invested her loan to purchase various goods for re-sale. 
 
Sandra M. sells bijouterie and invested her loan to buy wholesale jewelery increase her sales and profits.

Daisy C. sells fruit and is using her loan to buy a greater amount of fruit at wholesale prices to increase her profits. 

Mary Matilda B. sells candy and is investing her loan to purchase a greater variety of goods. 

Simona G. sells clothes and is investing her loan to purchase shirts, jackets, shorts, and other seasonal clothing items to satisfy the demands of her customers. 

Ninfa S. sells lingerie and invests her loan to buy more and higher quality products. 

Digna B. sells plastic products and invested her loan to buy merchandise to increase her number of sales. 

Graciela F. sells clothes and is investing her loan to purchase shirts, jackets, shorts, and other seasonal clothing items to satisfy the demands of her customers.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to resell

loans.name: Virina

texts.en:
Virina is a single mother with three sons, all of whom are grown, ages 29, 23, and 19. Virina used to work as a maid in a home, but the pay was not good enough to support her family, so she decided to go into recycling.

Approximately 9 years ago, a kind gentleman gave Virina a stack of cartons which she could recycle immediately. So she started buying a horse and cart and began to go around the city collecting recyclable material. Now Virina has two carriages and horses, one of which is operated by her sons. Virina’s hope is that one day she will be able to buy a truck to move the materials faster and have more business. She will use her loan to invest in her venture.

loans.use: Business investment

loans.name: Florencia Margarita

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Florencia Margarita C. le está haciendo falta la elaboración de la barda al rededor en la porte de arriba de la casa. 
Ya que tiene unos cuartos que está rentando y quier que las personas que le rentan tenga mas seguridad y no quiere que pase un accidente por falta de la barda. 
Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para poder pagarle a la persona que va a encargar de  realiza la mejora y que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario. 
Planea pagar el crédito con la pensión que recibe por fallecimiento de su esposo, ya que los gastos familiares se encargara su hijo el joven Fernando Castro quien vive con ella y trabaja para un tienda comercial.
texts.en:
Señora Florencia Margarita C.’s house is missing a wall around by the back door of the house. As she has rooms that are rented out, she wishes to offer her customers more security and doesn’t want an accident to occur because of the lack of a wall. For this reason Florencia is asking for a loan so she can pay someone to do this job, as at the moment she doesn’t have enough money. She plans to repay it with the pension that she receives after her husband passed away. The household expenses are paid for by her son Fernando Castro who lives with her. He works in a store.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: build a wall near the back door

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
La señora Adriana G. esta muy agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual le ayudo mucho ha surtir su negocio y que creciera más en las ventas.
Nueva mente está solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar más mercancía de temporada de invierno ya que sus clientes le están pidiendo que venda ropa de frío, y desea acondicionar otra local para que su hijo le ayude a vender en diferentes partes de la ciudad y así tener otro ingreso a la familia ya que tiene los gastos de los niños de la escuela. 
Ella planea pagar este crédito con las ganancias de la inversión ya que con el otro negocio será para cubrir los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Sra. Adriana G. is very grateful for your cooperation. Her previous loan helped her restock her business and increase her sales.

She is requesting a new loan so that she can buy more winter merchandise, since her customers are requesting clothes to wear for the cold weather. Adriana also wants to establish another location so that her son can help sell merchandise in a different part of the city. This business enables her to earn extra income to pay for the school expenses of her younger children.

Adriana plans to repay this loan with the earnings resulting from this investment. Her other business will cover her family expenses.

(Click HERE to view the previous loan.)

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase winter merchandise

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr: FAtoumata C. est une femme de 39 ans, elle est divorcée et vit avec ses deux enfants dont elle a la charge. Elle fait de la transformation et vente de pâte d'arachide, elle vend également de l'huile de palme. Les bénéfices générés par son petit commerce lui permettent de prendre en charge ses enfants.
texts.en:
Fatoumata C. is a 39-year-old divorcée who lives with her two children who she supports. She processes and sells peanut butter, and she also sells palm oil. The income generated by her small business allows her to take care of her children's needs.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To promote her business activity

loans.name: Pascual

texts.es:
El señor Pascual B. es padre de familia y tiene tres hijos a quienes les quiere dar lo mejor. 
Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para poder construir un cuarto en la parte trasera de la casa ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material ya que se encargara de realizar la construcción en horarios adicionales a su trabaja.
 Don Pascual y su esposa la señora Flumencia Acuña desean que sus hijos tengan su propia recamara en su casa ya que también les servirá para poner un pequeño estudio para los trabajos de la escuela.  
Planean pagar el crédito con una parte de sus ingresos que obtiene de su trabajo en una agencia aduanal en el departamento de limpieza. 
Las personas que aparecen en la foto es Doña Flumencia y una de sus hijas ya que el señor Pascual se encontraba en su trabaja el día de la visita.
texts.en:
Mr. Pascual B. is the father of a family and has 3 children to whom he wishes to give the best he can. For this reason, he is soliciting a loan to construct a room on the back of his house. He lacks the money necessary to buy the materials but he will do the work after his normal working hours.

Pascual and his wife, Mrs. Flumencia Acuña, want their children to have a proper bedroom in their house, plus a useful little studio where they can do their school work. They plan to pay off the loan with a part of the income from his job in the cleaning department of the customs agency.

The people appearing in the photo are Mrs. Flumencia and one of her daughters since Pascual was at work on the day of the visit.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO CONSTRUCT A ROOM ON THE BACK OF THE HOUSE FOR THEIR CHILDREN

loans.name: Catalino

texts.en: Catalino M. has his own house and is engaged in the production and sale of bedspreads and hammocks, having been a merchant in Asuncion for several years prior. Catalino has been a client of the Fundacion Paraguaya since 2002, has taken out several loans and has paid back all of them on time. This year, he needs a loan to buy yarn and raw material for the production of bedsheets and hammocks.

loans.use: Buy raw material

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: El Señor José P. C. es una persona que labora en la Dirección General de Ingreso. Es Casado tiene dos hijos. Este cliente ha obtenido dos créditos con CEPRODEL el que ha utilizado para mejora de la vivienda y la compra de un aparato de topográfica el cual lo utiliza en su desempeño laboral. Es una persona con un excelente  record crediticio. Es una persona trabajadora y puntual en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Sr. José P. C. works for the Director General of Income (the local tax authority). He is married and has two children. José obtained two previous loans from CEPRODEL that were used for home improvements and the purchase of a topography apparatus that he uses for his job. He has an excellent credit record and is known for working hard and making his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase topography equipment for use in his job

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama D. est une femme de 53 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KOUNKANE de 3 ans et y a bénéficié de 6 prêts qu'elle a bien gérés et remboursés. Elle fait de la transformation et vente de pâte d'arachide. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Mariama D., aged 53, is married and the mother of three children. She has been a member of the village bank Kounkané for three years and received six loans which she managed well and repaid on schedule. She produces and sells peanut butter. She participates in the improvement of the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her business

loans.name: Elena Santacruz

texts.en: Elena S. Santacruz has her own home and has a successful business selling handmaD. products such as bedspreads, hammocks and clothes according to customer orders. Elena has been a client since 2003, having paid off all her loans on time. This year, she has taken out a loan to buy more goods, such as yarn and dye, to make better quality products that she can sell at a higher profit.

loans.use: Yarn and dye

loans.name: Julian Reyes

texts.es:
Julián Reyes y su esposa son una familia unida que inspira confianza. A pesar D. L. edad ellos no han dejado D. trabajar para mantenerse, hace cuatro años buscaron L. manera D. ganar dinero y decidieron poner un negocio D. abarrotes, por que en L. colonia donD. viven las tiendas son muy escasas. Esta tienda es nombrada “Miscelánea Los tres Vallejos” que da honor a su apellido y a L. cantidad D. hijos que tiene. 
Sus hijos lo apoyan económicamente; desD. hace varios años ellos decidieron cruzar a los estados Unidos para obtener un mejor trabajo y dar mejor calidad a sus hijos como a sus  padres que viven en México. Julián se ve el necesidad D. surtir su negocio por L. época naviD.ña por que viene mucha gente D. fuera D. L. ciudad y hay más compra D. refrescos, frituras y abarrotes en general.
texts.en:
Julián Reyes and his wife are a close family who inspire confidence. In spite of their age, they haven't stopped working to support themselves. Four years ago, they looked for a way to earn money and they decdied to start a grocery business. In the area where they live, stores are very scarce. This store is called, "Miscelánea Los Tres Vallejos" (The Three Vallejos Miscellaneous), which honors their last name and the number of kids they have. Their children support them economically. Several years ago, their kids decided to go to the United States to get better jobs and to improve their children's quality of life as well as that of their parents, who live in Mexico. Julián sees the need to supply his business for the Christmas season because many people come from outsiD. the city and they will buy more soft drinks, fried foods, and groceries in general.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock merchandise

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en: Francisco M. is 21 years old, lives with his parents and sells handmade products in his neighborhood, such as bedspreads and hammocks. Francisco started his business three years ago, with the help and guidance of his parents, as they also sell handmade bedsheets and hammocks. Francisco will use the loan to buy more yarn and dye.

loans.use: Yarn and dye

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Ndèye

texts.fr: Ndèye D. est une femme de 53, elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KOUNKANE depuis 3 ans et y a réalisé de belles performances en terme de crédit et d'épargne. Elle développe une activité de petit commerce: elle vend de la pâte d'arachide, de l'encens emballé dans des sachets plastiques, des bijoux, de la pâte d'arachide en faisant du porte-à-porte. Elle soutien son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Ndèye D., aged 53, is married and the mother of seven children. She has been a member of the village bank Kounkané for three years and has performed well in terms of loans and savings. She is active in a small business, namely she hawks peanut butter, incense packed in small plastic bags and jewelry. She helps her husband with the family expenses.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her investment capacity

loans.name: Maïmouna

texts.fr: Maïmouna D. est âgée de 40 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle fait de la transformation et vente de pâte d'arachide. Elle a une bonne expérience de cette activité pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis plus de 5 ans. Elle soutien son mari dans les charges collectives de la famille.
texts.en:
Maïmouna D., aged 40, is married and the mother of five children. She produces and sells peanut butter. She is very experienced in this business, as she has practiced it for over five years. She helps her husband with the common expenses of the family.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To boost her activity

loans.name: Pablo Emilio Aguilar Montes

texts.es:
El señor Pablo Emilio A. M. ha adquirido con CEPRODEL dos créditos en dos años, siendo un excelente cliente, es trabajador en la Alcaldía de Managua como recolector de basura.

Los créditos que ha obtenido le han permitido mejorar su vivienda y por lo tanto incrementar su calidad de vida de él y de su familia. Ya que anteriormente vivía en condiciones no muy adecuadas.

El se siente muy agradecido por la oportunidad que se le ha brindado, y espera seguir trabajando más créditos con CEPRODEL para seguir mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Pablo Emilio A. M. has received two loans from CEPRODEL in two years. He is an excellent client, working in the mayoralty of Managua as a trash collector. The loans he has received have allowed him to improve his home, and thus improve his quality of life and that of his family, as previously they lived in unsuitable conditions. Pablo is very grateful for this opportunity, and hopes to continue working with more loans from CEPRODEL to further improve his quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the repair of part of the roof: purchase of zinc sheets and wood

loans.name: Hector

texts.en:
Hector O. is 46 years old, and has been married for over 23 years to Petrona Fleitas, who is 50 years old. Together they have 5 children, 3 of whom are fully grown and independent and 2 of whom are of school age. Twenty years ago, Hector started a pantry from their home, which his wife helped him run while he was finishing his studies to become a teacher. Together they earned enough profit to support their family. Now they own a nice house and a successful pantry in the city.

They will use their loan to buy more goods such as drinks and necessities, such as flour, sugar, herbs, oil and noodles.

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: San

texts.en: San P., 33, is married with two school-age children. She lives in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia with her husband and children. To make a living, she runs a grocery store at home, earning $5 US per day. Her husband helps his wife with the business and he is a motorbike repairman, earning approximately $2 US per day. P. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, P. is asking for a loan of $700 US to purchase a variety of groceries to restock her store. She hopes that her plan of expanding her business will be successful so that she is able to handle more customers.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to restock the store

loans.name: Lorelie

texts.en:
Entrepreneur Lorelie S. is interested in expanding her curtain business and adding some items like different styles of bed sheets. She also plans to get involved in selling meat in the market. She is 33 years old, married to Weny S. and has two children, namely Michaela Louriz and Reimuz Rodel S., who are in grade school. They live in Caniogan, Morong, Rizal.

Lorelie had been a member of ASHI for 11 years now and had been sewing curtains and selling them in other towns for almost 10 years. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 Philippine pesos to purchase bed sheets, Sylvia Blue curtains, Gina Printed Blue, peach, pink and maroon curtains and to purchase meat for the market. She’s hoping for the best in their lives and this is a big step for her and her family. This loan will make their dreams come true: to have their children finish their studies and to have a comfortable house of their own to live in. They also dream of buying their own tricycle for a business. Like most families here, they are just hoping for the best and knocking on your good hearts for the kind support you can give.

loans.use: To purchase bed sheets, curtains and meat

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy C. is from the village of Comon Poblacion, Mambajao, Camiguin. She is 25 years old and single. To make a living, Joy owns and operates a business making and selling food. She sells snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Joy has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $107 a month from these activities.

In June 2009, Joy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Joy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Joy is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells

loans.name: Liberato

texts.en: Liberato owns a tire shop located at the very entrance to the city. He has been running the shop for more than three years. He is married to Maria Ines Flores, with whom he has two children. He has a stable and loyal clientele, who are attracted to his services by the good quality and reliability of his work. He has been a client of the Fundacion Paraguaya since 2008. He needs a loan in order to increase the inventory of goods he offers and improve the quality of his services.

loans.use: To buy goods

loans.name: Aïssatou Aïmady

texts.fr: Aïssatou est une femme de 49 ans elle mariée et mère d'un enfant en charge. Elle a une bonne expérience avec le crédit pour en avoir bénéficié à plus de 10 fois. Elle est restauratrice, elle prépare ses repas à domicile et fait le tour des marchés hebdomadaires pour la vente. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
Aïssatou, aged 49, is married and the mother of a dependent child. She is very experienced with the credit process, as she has received already over ten loans. She is a caterer; she prepares her dishes at home and tours the weekly markets to sell them. She participates in the improvement of the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To promote her business

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda C. is from the village of Benoni, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 43 years old and married with five school-aged children. To make a living, Glenda owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail store. She sells a variety of different products and also cell phone loads (prepaid credits) in the local community. Glenda has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $75 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Glenda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Glenda is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sard

texts.en: Sard V., 56, is married with five children. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, with her husband and children. To make a living, she runs a business of selling souvenirs and soft drinks to tourists at a Temple, earning an average income of $7 a day. Her husband always helps his wife in this business. V. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, V. is asking for a loan of $600 to purchase a store near the temple to expand her souvenir selling business.

loans.use: buy a souvenir shop hear the temple

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic D. is from the village of Baylao, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 48 years old and married with eight school-aged children. To make a living, Marivic owns and operates a business selling wood and wood-related products in the local community. Marivic has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately $133 a month from these activities.

In 2008, Marivic joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Marivic has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. She is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
At 56 years old, still dreaming of rising up from poverty, Mrs. Rosela V. is an entrepreneur married to Danilo V., a farmer.
