She is blessed with three children: Irene V., a clerk in the bank; Jonas Patrick, a security guard; and Jane Lansel, a teacher in elementary grades. Two of them are living with her and Jonas has his own family. 

Rosela has been in her sari-sari store (a small retail store) business for ten years now. But still the business earns just enough to provide their daily needs provided that they are all living in the same house. Their children are working but their income is not enough for all of them.

If the loan is funded, Rosela will use the money to expand the store to gain more profit and to serve her customers to accommodate their needs because the population is getting larger in their area. She is hoping that her sari-sari store becomes a grocery store. She also benefits from getting a loan from ASHI because the profit she will earn will improve their standard of living.

Rosela desires to help her grandchildren to finish their studies and to develop their house to have a comfortable shelter to live in.

loans.use: To purchase goods for her store like rice, cigarettes and charcoal

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
This is Marivic M.. She is 40 years old and a farmer’s wife.  She lives with her husband, Maximo, in Lumil, Silang, Cavite.

Marivic has been selling a variety of vegetables, coconuts, and other raw food items for five years now on a makeshift stall.  She sets up a table every day near the village road and displays her vegetables to sell.  She enjoys her work because she gets to meet all sorts of people.  She earns more than $340 a month.  She earns more when the weather is fine, but when it rains it’s hard for her to go out and sell.

She is now on her eleventh loan cycle with the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative.  She joined this cooperative in 2006.   Marivic applied for a new loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP as additional capital for her food market business.

Marivic wants her children to finish college.



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: additional capital for her food market business

loans.name: Keng

texts.en:
Keng K., 49, is married with four children. She lives in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia with her husband and children. To make a living, she sells food from a cart attached to a motorbike. She has new and established customers and earns $5 US per day. Her husband helps with the business. The family is also supported by three of the children who are currently employed in a local garment factory earning $5 US each to help cover the family's expenses.

K. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, K. is asking for a loan of $1000 US to purchase more food to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy food for a food cart

loans.name: Antonina

texts.es:
La señora Antonina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Corazón de Jesús”, Distrito de San Jose de Sisa, Provincia del Dorado, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 49 años y 03 hijos, los 03 que aun dependen de ella.

Deseando ver profesional a sus hijos y tener sus propios ingresos para poder lograrlo, decidió emprender su propio negocio. Nos cuenta que en su trayectoria paso por muchas dificultades, pero su espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante sola, le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de refrescos.
En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y le va muy bien, tiene 05 años ya, ejerciendo este tipo de actividad, tiene sus clientes fijos y ya es conocida por sus clientes y por la buena sazón de sus comidas.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará insumos para preparar sus refrescos como: linaza, cebada, boldo, cola de caballo y soya, todos esto lo comprará quincenalmente en kilos

Antonina, se siente con muchas fuerzas para seguir con sus ventas de refrescos y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Sra. Antonina is a member of the Heart of Jesus Communal Bank, which is located in the District of San Jose de Sisa, El Dorado Province, Department of San Martín. She is 49 years old and has 3 dependent children.

Antonina started her own business so that she could support her children in hopes of seeing them become professionals who can earn their own income. She has experienced many difficulties, but she is known for her fighting spirit and has the desire to succeed for herself. Therefore, she started this business selling soft drinks. Antonina has been managing her business for 5 years and is prospering. She has regular customers who know her well and enjoy the great flavor of her products.

With this loan of 2000 soles, she will purchase supplies for preparing drinks such as flaxseed, barley, herbal tea, horsetail plant, and soybeans. Antonia acquires these ingredients by the kilo every two weeks. She is determined to continue her soft drink business and thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her fulfill her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for preparing beverages

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth D. runs a sari-sari (variety retail store) selling a variety of different products in her community. She is 32 years old, married and has two school-age children. They are from the village of Bonbon, Catarman, Camiguin Province. Janeth has been in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Janeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Janeth is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.en: Tomasa C. A. is 44 years old.  She started a business selling used clothing and that developed into a boutique with nicer clothes. She sells good quality clothing, and has built up a loyal customer base. She also distributes her products to other bigger stores. Tomasa needs a loan to buy more merchandise to increase her profits.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for her boutique.

loans.name: Aïssatou

texts.fr: AÏssatou D. a 23 ans, elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 4 ans et a acquière une bonne expérience en matière de crédit. Elle fait de la transformation et vente de pâte d'arachide. Elle participe aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Aïssatou D., aged 23, is married and the mother of a child. She has been a member of a village bank for four years and is very experienced with the credit process. She produces and sells peanut butter. She participates in the daily expenses of her family.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To promote her activity

loans.name: Noelina

texts.es:
La señora Noelina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Corazón de Jesús”, Distrito de San José de Sisa, Provincia del Dorado, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 36 años y es madre de 04 hijos, 02 que aun depende de ella. 

Anteriormente Noelina, se dedicaba a la venta de cosméticos, hoy en día lleva 03 años dedicándose a la venta de abarrotes. Noelina, tuvo que pasar por altas y bajas, para llegar a ser una pequeña empresaria y administrar su propio negocio y generar sus propios ingresos, sin dar cuentas a nadie. 

Con su esfuerzo y vigor, llego a implementar su bodega, es muy conocida por sus clientes en el barrio donde vive y sus ventas diarias son buenas. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio ubicada en su misma casa, en un local muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en sacos, insumos para el aseo personal, gaseosas en paquetes y productos variados para mantener contenta a su clientela. 

Ella es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante para el bienestar de su familia y de ella misma. Manifiesta su agradecimiento al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer y apoyar a otras mujeres que también quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Sra. Noelina is a member of the Heart of Jesus Communal Bank, located in the District of San José de Sisa, El Dorado Province, Department of San Martín. She is 36 years old, in a common law marriage, and has four children of whom two are still dependents.

Noelina previously sold cosmetics, but now she has her own grocery store and has been in business for three years. She endured several highs and lows to get the point where she is now. Noelina is able to generate her own income without having to report to anyone.

She invested a lot of strength and energy to open her store, which is now well-known among her customers in the neighborhood where she lives. Her sales have been very good. Noelina continues to manage her store out of her home, which is well-suited for accommodating her customers.

With this loan of 2000 soles, she will buy more products to restock her store such as sacks of rice and sugar, personal hygiene products, packs of sodas, and other different products to keep her customers happy. Noelina is eager to move forward for the sake of her family. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her grow as an entrepreneur and supporting other women who want to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to increase her inventory

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma D. is from the village of Quiboro, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 43 years old. Emma is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Emma owns & operates a business providing hairdressing & beauty services to local community members. Emma has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In May 2009, Emma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. Emma is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. It's Emma's discretion to take the same loan amount. This loan will be the second taken out by Emma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide hairdressing & beauty services

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
A business-minded woman, Merly B. is from Tagbak, Antipolo, a gorgeous province of Rizal.  She has been running a sari-sari store (a convenience store) for over 10 years. She is also involved in retail Electronic Load (Smart, Sun and Globe Load). Merly is a mother of two children, married to Gregorio B., a Security Guard.

Merly's husband's income was insufficient to meet the needs of their family, so, Merly joined ASHI (Ahon SA Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, in 2000. She was given hope and opportunity to access capital, so she started her sari-sari store business. The business has been successful and provides them a good income. For her eighth loan, she is requesting Php 35,000 pesos as additional capital to purchase some stock and renovate her store.

She hopes that with the help of ASHI and KIVA, she can achieve her dreams in life: sending her children to school until they find jobs, improving her business, and developing her sari-sari store into a Grocery Store. She now feels that her dreams are within reach.

loans.use: To purchase assorted goods.

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en: Sorn C., 29, is married with two school-aged children. She resides in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia with her husband and children. To make a living, she runs a business selling cosmetic products and providing public phone service, earning collectively an income of US $5 per day. Her husband always helps his wife in the business. He is also a public local primary school teacher, earning an income of US $1.9 to help cover the family expenses. C. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, C. is asking for a loan of US $700 to build a bigger shop and buy more prepaid mobile cards for resale.

loans.use: To build a bigger shop and buy prepaid mobile cards

loans.name: Halimatou Habibou

texts.fr: Halimatou Habibou D. est une femme de 50 ans elle est mariée et mère de 10 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois et a eu 13 bonnes expériences avec le crédit. Elle fait de la restauration, elle prépare ses mets à domicile et fréquente pratiquement tous les marchés hebdomadaires de sa localité pour vendre ses repas. Elle participe à la nourriture de la famille.
texts.en:
Halimatou Habibou D., aged 50, is married and the mother of ten children. She is a member of a village bank and has successfully managed 13 loans. She is a caterer; she prepares her dishes at home and tours nearly all the weekly markets of her town to sell them. She helps with providing food for her family.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To support her business

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly D. is from the village of Poblacion, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 51 years old. Beverly is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Beverly owns & operates a business selling green bananas in the local community. Beverly has been engaged in her business for over five  years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Beverly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Beverly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from HSPFI. Beverly is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Beverly from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Chanthou's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Chanthou S. is the group leader of six members who all live in Ampov Prey Pir village in Kandal Province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Now she wants to breed pigs to earn an income. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy some piglets, fertilizer, and a battery for her household.  Her husband, Mr. Ty Chantha, is a construction worker. Mrs. Chanthou S. is 33 years old and the mother of three children. Two of the children attend the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy piglets, fertilizer and a battery for her household.

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Chantha C. is the group leader of four members who all live in Damnak village in Takeo province. She is a grocer. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more grocery products to resell to earn more income. Her husband, Mr. Choem Sophara, is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare field of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Chantha C. is 19 years old and the mother of a child who is just four months old.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products to resell

loans.name: Sokvy

texts.en:
Mr. Sokvy P., 35, and his wife, Mrs. Sreyroth In, 27, live in a small village in suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married for almost 10 years and have two daughters. One is in school and other one stays at home.  

Mr. Sokvy P. is a motor taxi driver. He drives in Phnom Penh and is able to earn 20,000.00 riel per day. His wife is a garment factory worker. Sokvy hopes to organize the house where he lives to become neat, so he is asking for his first loan of $800 in order to repair his house.

loans.use: To repair the house where he lives.

loans.name: Seang La's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Seang La C. is the group leader of four members who all live in Srah Trakuon village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a one-hectare field of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. So Rith, is a construction worker. Mrs. Seang La C. is requesting a loan to buy a cow for breeding to earn more income. She is 26 years old and the mother of a child who is just 2 years old.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Ammie

texts.en: Ammie, 28, is a farmer from Surallah, South Cotabato. She is married to Randolf and they have four children. The eldest child is eight years old. She works in the rice field, and this is the main source of income on which her family depends. She wants to continue to support her family through rice farming and she joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. with the aim to acquire a loan for her business. She has requested 15,000 PHP to provide the needs for her farm.

loans.use: To buy rice farming supplies.

loans.name: Genie

texts.en: Genie B. is 47 years old and lives in the village of Cataggaman Viejo, Tuguegarao City. She is married to Vicente B. who is a local tricycle driver in their village. They are blessed with three children who are all college graduates, married, and working professionals. Kristofferson, age 30, is an engineer in real estate, Kent Gilbert, age 29, works at a private company, and Karyll Joy, age 23, works in the Veterans Hospital. Despite the economic crisis, Genie and her husband work hard to improve their living conditions and save for their future because they are not getting any younger. Their main source of income is from farming rice and corn. Also, Genie does direct selling of books for children. She goes to different schools to sell the books which she usually purchases in Manila. As a fruit of her patience and sacrifice, she earns a net income of PHP 5,500  which she uses to meet her family needs. She is now requesting a loan from the KIVA lenders amounting to PHP 15,000 which she will use to buy more books to sell.

loans.use: To buy more books to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.en: Sergio is 42 years old, and owns a home where he lives with his two children and wife. For several years, Sergio has been working as a mason in construction. He has plenty of business thanks to his reputation for good quality work and loyal customer base. On the weekends, Sergio works as a peddler in the area of Luque where the Fundacion Paraguaya is located. Sergio will use the loan to purchase tools.

loans.use: To buy masonry tools.

loans.name: Mrs. Seu Suon Village Bank Group

texts.en: A village bank loan that consists of ten people is located in Trapeang Chaeng village in Takeo province and all the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Seu S. is the village bank president. She is a pig breeder. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets and pig food. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Sin Pao, is a farmer who owns a two-hectare field of land to cultivate rice. This couple has three children. One of the children is employed in a garment factory, one is a laborer and one attends the local school.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and pig food

loans.name: Sam-Oeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam-oeun V., 49, and her husband Mr. Pork Mat, 53, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1979. They have seven children: three sons and four daughters. Two of them are married and live outside the family home; one has full-time employment; three attend school and one stays at home.  

Sam-oeun has been a babysitter for two years, while her husband Mr. Pork Mat, has been a farmer for 20 years. She now wants to supplement her income with another business raising cows. She will able to earn extra income from selling cows when the cows grow big enough. 

Hence, Sam-oeun is asking for a loan of $600 to purchase cows to raise.

loans.use: To purchase cows to raise.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel T. is 43 years old, married, and has been a resident of the province of Rizal for almost 16 years.  She has 4 children with her loving husband, a 55-year-old electrician named Joel T.. Her eldest child is a college student, the middle two are in high school, and the youngest is in grade school. 

Raquel is in the clothing business and has already had seven loans from ASHI.  All her previous loans have been paid in full and on time, which is why she is now being trusted with a bigger loan. She is asking for PHP 30,000, which she plans to use to expand her business and sell a greater variety of clothing products.  She believes the bigger her business is, the bigger her profit will be.  

All of Raquel’s perseverance and effort is simply designed to give her children the best in their education and future. As a housewife, she also wants to support her husband with all the family expenses, and to contribute toward the building of a more accommodating and comfortable house for their family. These things will all be possible if the proposed loan is granted.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of clothing products to sell

loans.name: Yolith

texts.es:
La señora Yolith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Corazón D. Jesús”, Distrito D. San José D. Sisa, Provincia del Dorado, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 63 años y es madre D. 07 hijos, todos ellos ya independientes.

Ante la necesidad D. aportar al ingreso económico del hogar, motivada por su esposo y ella misma, emprendió su pequeño negocio D. abarrotes, con su primer crédito D. S/. 300.00, obteniendo muy buenos resultados desD. un inicio; por sus precios cómodos y la buena atención al cliente. Se encuentra  ubicada en su misma casa, en un local muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio, donD. sus principales clientes son los vecinos y amigos D. su barrio.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00, comprará  más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en kilos, huevos en javas,  insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, gaseosas en paquetes, golosinas  y otros productos para mantener contenta a su clientela. 

Hoy se siente muy feliz D. la labor y servicio que brinda y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a personas como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas familias y mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Yolith belongs to the community bank "Corazón D. Jesús", district of San José D. Sisa, province of Dorado, region of San Martín. She is married, 63 years old, and the mother of 7 children, all of whom live independently. Faced with the need to contribute to the household earnings, she and her husband launched her small grocery business. With her first loan of S/. 300.00, she has been getting very good results since the business's opening due to the store's affordable prices and good customer service. She attends to her customers in her own home, a well equipped space for business. She continues with this same business where her primary customers are her neighbors and friends from the neighborhood. With this loan of S/. 1,000.00 she will buy more products to supply her business with merchandise like rice and sugar in bulk, eggs, personal hygiene and house cleaning products, packaged soda pops, candy, and other products that will keep her clientele satisfied. She feels very happy about the labor and services offered to her and gives her appreciation to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping people like herself who want to work and come out ahead. She hopes that the organization continues offering these services for a long time and that they help many entrepreneuring families and women.

Translated from Spanish by Colleen Godfrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy groceries to increase her merchandise size.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
This is Edna P., a 38-year-old woman who lives with her husband Richard and their four children in a serene barrio in Silang, Cavite.

She has been in the transportation business for the last 10 years.  She owns and manages a motorized tricycle unit and she sells soft drinks as an additional source of family income.  Edna earns a net income of P4,000.00 a month.

Edna is now taking her fifth loan from the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative.  She religiously repays her loan with the cooperative on a weekly basis. She has earned the trust and confidence of its staff and other members.  She has applied for a new loan of P11,000.00.  She will use the funds to renew the government permit and franchise for the tricycle unit.  Some of the money will be used for the preventive maintenance of the tricycle units, including spare rubber tires and other spare parts.

She hopes her children will be able to complete their schooling. 



 About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Preventive maintenance of her tricycles

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline U. is from the village of San Roque, Maramag, Bukidnon. She is 36 years old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Evangeline sells snacks such as hot cakes and twisted bread in the local community. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

Evangeline joined HSPFI this year for financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid her first HSPFI loan of 5000 PHP, and now requests her second loan, for 8000 PHP, so she can improve her business.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in improving her business.

loans.name: Yolith

texts.es:
La señora Yolith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Corazón de Jesús”, Distrito de San José de Sisa, Provincia del Dorado, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 40 años y es madre de 03 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella.

Lleva 02 años dedicándose a la venta de abarrotes, gracias a las ganancias obtenidas, con su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 logró implementar su negocio, que se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa, un local muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes, hoy sus vecinos y amigos ya le conocen y tiene mucha acogida, sus ventas le salen a pedir de boca y piensa seguir adelante y prosperar con otros negocios.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará abarrotes como: sacos de arroz y azúcar, paquetes de leches y aceites; gaseosas en paquetes de diferentes sabores y tamaños e insumos para la limpieza del hogar e higiene personal. Así de esta manera mantener a sus clientes satisfechos y contentos.

Se siente muy satisfecha con el trabajo que realiza, cree que vale el sacrificio para cumplir sus sueños y metas que tiene trazado en su vida. Así mismo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle apoyo a ella y a  demás mujeres que quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yolith belongs to the communal bank "Corazon de Jesus", in the district of San Jose de Sisa, province of Dorado, and department of San Martin. She is married, 40 years old, and is the mother of three children, two of whom still depend on her. For two years she has worked selling groceries, thanks to the earnings she has obtained. With her first credit of S/ 300.00 she managed to set up her business, which is located in her house, a very well-equipped place to attend to her customers. Today her neighbors and friends know her well, and she is very well accepted. Her sales are going just fine, and she plans to keep moving ahead and prosper with other businesses. With this loan of S/ 1,000.00, she will purchase groceries such as: sacks of rice and sugar, packages of milk and oil, soft drinks of different flavors and sizes, and materials for cleaning her home and personal hygiene. In this way she will be able to keep her clients satisfied and content. She is very satisfied with the job that she performs. She believes that it is worth the sacrifice to fulfill her dreams and goals that she has laid out in her life. Likewise, she thanks the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for providing support to her and other women that want to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase groceries to increase her variety of products

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 24 years old and married to Juanito, who works as a farmer. They live in the villaage of Cataggaman Viejo, Tuguegarao City, together with their three children: 5-year-old Melanie, 3-year-old Maria Lian, and 1-year-old Jhon Oliver.  Elena is thankful for such a loving family that chooses to be happy despite the hardships of life.

Elena chose hog raising as her business. At present, she would like to request a loan of PHP 18,000, which she plans to use to buy additional piglets and feed. She dreams of sending her children to college and of them having a better way of life someday. As a mother, she will do her very best to succeed in her endeavor.  She has promised herself that she will work hard for the education of her children and provide them with their needs.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets and feed

loans.name: Tserenlham

texts.en:
G. Tserenlham is 49 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in a house in Uvurkhangai province, Mongolia. Her daughter, Ariuntuya, is 24 years old and works as a secondary school teacher. Tserenlham operates a flour and rice trading business in her town with the help of her husband. She travels to Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital and largest city, once a month to purchase her products, and then transports them back for sale. 

Tserenlham started her business in 2009 after managing a clothing trading business for 6 years. She is a very knowledgeable businesswoman and has much experience managing a small business.  She hopes to grow her business quickly and already has plans for the future. She is a very responsible person and is known for her good character. She says, "I hope to own my own workplace in the future." She is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug ($2,100 USD) loan to purchase flour and rice to sell.

loans.use: to purchase flour and rice to sell

loans.name: Phem

texts.en: Phem V., 30, is married with three school-aged children. She resides in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia with her husband and children. To make a living, she runs a dessert selling business, earning about $4 per day. Her husband always helps her with the business. Also he provides taxi services in town with his motorbike, earning about $5 a day to help cover the family expenses, when the motorbike is working. V. and her husband strive to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, V. requests a loan of $600 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband because the old motorbike is not reliable and often breaks down.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
38-year-old Sonia S. Filipe dreams of giving the best to her children in their education and future. Her and her husband Marvin S. Filipe hope to build a more accommodating and comfortable house for their family. She has two children: 12-year-old Niervin and 9-year-old Lloyd Angelo, both in grade school. To do this she plans to expand her business.

Sonia S. F. has proposed amounting Php 30,000.00 for additional capital for her spare parts business. This loan will be a great help for making their dreams come true and little by little her business selling of spare parts a full shop someday. For seven years as a member of ASHI she has been trusted with loans that have improved their standard of living. Sonia S. F. is also good adviser. Even at this young age she motivates her children to finish their studies in college because education is the only thing she can give that other people can’t steal.

loans.use: additional capital for her spare parts business

loans.name: Mrs. Thoeun Pin Village Bank Group

texts.en: These eleven residents of Skul Village in Takeo Province together request a village bank loan. Mrs. Thoeun P. was selected by the members to be the president. She is a pig breeder and also a farmer who owns 1.5-hectare field of land to cultivate rice, but she is challenged due to infertile soil. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the rice field to make the crop more productive. Mrs. Thoeun P. is 32 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is attending the local school while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Run Ran, is a construction worker.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her rice field.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie, or “Marie” as she is called in their village, is engaged in hog raising. She is now 36 years old and married to Lamberto a local tricycle driver and they are blessed with three children: Romarie - 14 years old, a second year high school student ;Romalyn - 12 years old, a freshman high school student; Jhon Raffy - 10 years old, grade school. Aside from raising hogs, they are also engaged in farming as a major source of income. They plant rice, vegetables and root crops. She lives happily in the rural area of Barangay Cataggaman Viejo Tuguegarao City with her family.

Rosemarie and her husband send their children to school hoping that they will finish their studies and have good jobs someday. The couple is glad that, despite the difficulties in life they are experiencing, they have been able to support their children's studies.

Because of their desire to save for the future, Rosemarie was encouraged to request a loan of Php 13,000 to maintain and improve their business. The loan will be used to buy additional piglets and feed for their hogs. She will also use some of the money for the general maintenance of her husdband's tricycle. They hope to increase their income with this financial assistance. They are so thankful to the lenders who are willing to assist them financially.

loans.use: buy additional piglets and feed for their hogs and maintenance on her husband's vehicle

loans.name: Soam

texts.en: Soam B., 45, is married with three school-aged children. She resides in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia with her husband and children. To make a living, she runs a business selling various kinds of groceries at home, earning a gross income of US $20 per day. Her husband always helps her with the business. Also, he offers taxi services in town using his motorbike, earning an income of about $2.50 a day to help cover the family expenses. B. and her husband wish to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, B. is asking for a loan of $1000 to purchase more groceries to stock in the store.

loans.use: To stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Cidlia

texts.es:
La señora Cidlia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Corazón de Jesús”, Distrito de San José de Sisa, Provincia del Dorado, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 43 años y 02 hijos,  que aun dependen de ella.

Cidlia, se dedica a la venta de útiles de escritorio, nos cuenta que ya tiene experiencia en este tipo de actividad, al que ya viene dedicándose 02 años. Se inicio con un capital de S/. 1,000.00 y poco a poco fue incrementando sus ganancias y haciéndose muy conocida en el mercado. En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio y cuenta con un local muy bien acondicionado, para atender sus clientes fijos que viven en el barrio y amigos conocidos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará más productos para su stock como: cuadernos, lápices, borradores lapiceros, plumones, engrapadores. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de andamios para mostrar sus productos.

Cidlia, tiene un carisma para vender a sus clientes, comenta que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos como organización ayuda a las mujeres a desarrollarse y progresar con la misma oportunidad que el varón.
texts.en:
Cidlia is a member of the "Corazón de Jesús" (Heart of Jesus) Communal Bank, in the San José de Sisa District, in the Province of El Dorado, in the Department of San Martín. She is 43 years-old and has 2 children, who still depend on her. Cidlia works selling desk and office supplies. She says she has two years of experience in this business. She began with S/1,000.00 as capital, and little by little increased her earnings, making herself known in the market. Currently she is continuing with this same business and says her store is very well-fitted to serve her loyal customers who live in the neighborhood and her friends. With this loan of S/3,000.00 Cidlia will buy more products to stock her inventory, such as: notebooks, pencils, mechanical pencils, pens, erasers, and staplers. Some of the funds will also be invested in the purchase of shelves to display the merchandise. Cidlia is very charismatic while selling to her customers. She says Movimiento Manuela Ramos as an organization helps women develop and progress economically with the same opportunities as men.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products to increase store inventory.

loans.name: Delmar

texts.en:
Motorcycle transport is the primary source of income of Delmar and his wife Shanalyn in the village of Barangay Cataggaman Viejo Tuguegarao City. Aside from the transportation business, Delmar is also engaged in farming, while Shanalyn is a hog raiser in their village to earn extra income. 

For the continuous development of their transportation business, Delmar is again requesting a loan amounting to PHP 12,000 from lenders. He hopes that his loan will be approved again to enable him to maintain his motorcycle transport business. 

Delmar and Shanalyn are blessed with only one child. The couple hopes that their only child could finish a degree course.

loans.use: addtional capital for the maintenance of his vehicle

loans.name: Roem's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Roem K. is 21 years old and she is the group leader of this five member loan group. They all live in Srei Duoch Village in Takeo Province. Mrs. Roem K. is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she grows rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Nget Veth, is a laborer. Although they work hard, they still earn less income than they need to support themselves. In order to increase their earning potential, Mrs. Roem K. requests a loan to buy piglets and pig food for breeding. This couple does not have any children.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig food for breeding.

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en: Mrs. Chanthy R., age 32, and her husband, Mr. Sarath Seng, age 40, have been married for more than 10 years. They have one son and one daughter who both attend school.  She also has two nieces living with her, and they work in a garment factory. They live in a small village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  Chanthy has been a garment factory worker for over 4 years.  Her husband has been a security guard for 8 years. She is requesting her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for commuting to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.name: Tsevelsodnom

texts.en: T. Tsevelsodnom is 29 years old and lives with her parents and son in a house in Uvurkhangai province, Mongolia. Her son, Halhtulga is 6 years old and recently started primary school. Tsevelsodnom operates a dairy and meat product trading business with the help of her mother in their town. She started her business in 2000 selling dairy products and clothing, however, since 2008 sales of clothing have dropped dramatically and she recently dropped them in favor of selling meat. Sales of dairy products have remained strong and have brought her business success over the years. Selling meat has made her business more profitable and has stablized her earnings. Tsevelsodnom attributes her success to her good accounting skills and is making many plans for the future. She says, "My mother and I are planning to operate a livestock farm in the future." She is requesting a 2,300,000 tugrug (~1610 USD) loan to purchase more dairy products to sell in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dairy products to sell in her business

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La señora Luisa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Corazón de Jesús”, Distrito de San José de Sisa, Provincia del Dorado, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 46 años y es madre de 03 hijos, 02 que aun dependen y están bajo su poder.

Su carácter y su anhelo de cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes con cuyas ganancias aportaría al ingreso económico en su hogar, desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes. Hoy en día cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su bodega a comprar porque en ella  encuentran todo los productos  que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos; galletas, fideos y sales en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Luisa, se siente muy bien para continuar trabajando y esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Luisa is a member of the "Corazón de Jesús" (Heart of Jesus) Communal Bank, in the San José de Sisa District, in the Province of El Dorado, in the Department of San Martín. She is 46 years-old, lives with her partner, and is the mother of 3 children, 2 of which still depend on her. Her character and her desire to see her dreams realized motivated her to begin her own business selling groceries, whose profits she adds to the income of the household. From the beginning she has slowly been winning more customers. Today she has loyal customers who everyday come to her convenience store to shop because there they can find all the products a household needs, and because she personally attends to them with her usual charisma. With this loan of S/1000.00 she will buy bags of rice and sugar, cookies, noodles, salt packets, milk, conserved fish in boxes and in a variety of brands, eggs, and personal hygiene products, all to provide better service to her customers. Luisa is very happy to continue working and very grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping women like her have opportunities to develop in their different occupations.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of groceries to stock convenience store.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es:
La señora Amelia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Shatojinas Laboriosas”, Distrito de Shatoja, Provincia de San José de Sisa, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 34 años y es madre de 03 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Amelia, es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora, así que decidió poner su propio negocio de ventas de bebidas gasificadas y gelatinas, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en su misma casa. Es ella quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 150.00 y empezó comprando 04 paquetes de gaseosas, para probar como le va, vio que le iba muy bien y que le falto sus gaseosas, por lo que poco a poco fue invirtiendo mas. En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y ya es conocida por sus clientes que son sus vecinos, familiares y amigos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará más bebidas como: paquetes de gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas, como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas, también comprará kilos de azúcar e ingredientes, para preparar sus gelatinas y mazamorras.
 
Amelia, tiene muchas metas por delante y se siente muy motivada, así poder hacer realidad  sus sueños y lo que se propone. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando mas lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
Amelia is a member of the communal bank called Shatojinas Laboriosas, in the district of Shatoja in San Martin. She is 34 years and married with 3 children. Amelia is a hard worker and a fighter. She decided to set up a small business in her home to sell sodas and drinks. She is responsible for running her business, without a set schedule or a boss. She says she started her business by purchasing 4 boxes of sodas to see how they would sell. She saw that the business was good and she was soon out of sodas, so little by little she kept purchasing more. She continues to run her business now and is well known by her friends, neighbors and acquaintances. With the new loan she will purchase more sodas in different flavors, sizes and brands, mineral water, as well as sugar and other ingredients she uses to make her sweet drinks. Amelia has a lot of goals for the future and she feels very motivated. She appreciates the support that the organization Manuela Ramos gave her when she most needed it. She has been responsible with her payments and continues to do so.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sodas in different flavors, sizes and brands to stock her small business

loans.name: Analou

texts.en:
Analou B. is from the village of Catarman, Camiguin. She is 20 years old. Analou is single. To make a living, Analou owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Analou has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Analou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analou has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Analou is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mirelith

texts.es:
La señora Mirelth, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Shatojinas en Acción”, Distrito de Shatoja, Provincia del Dorado, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 34 años y es madre de 02 hijos, los 02 que aun dependen de ella.

Con el fin de contribuir con los ingresos económicos de su hogar le nace la idea de aperturar un pequeño negocio de venta de comidas preparadas y poco a poco fue ganando experiencia en este tipo de actividad, lleva ya 03 años en el negocio y le va muy bien en sus ventas y poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes.  
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con su rica sazón y la amabilidad que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,500.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, verduras diversas,  huevos y pollos en javas. También comprará algunos utensilios de cocina, para reemplazar a los que tiene actualmente y así brindar un mejor servicio y atención a sus clientes. 

Mirelith, se siente muy segura y con ganas de seguir adelante y asegurarse una  vida tranquila y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Mirelith is a member of the communal bank called Shatojinas en Accion, in the district of Shatoja in Dorado, San Martin. She is 34 years old and married with 2 children who depend on her. With the intention of helping with household costs, she decided to open a small cafe selling prepared meals and snacks, slowly gaining more experience along the way. She has now been running her business for 3 years, and things are going well. Over time, she has become well known and very well liked by her customers. She continues to run her business, personally attending to her customers with the good nature she is known for. With the new loan, she will purchase rice, sacks of sugar, various vegetables, eggs and chickens. She will also purchase a few kitchen utensils to replace what she has now, so she can offer better service to her customers. Merilith feels confident that her income will continue to grow, helping to provide her with a more tranquil life. She appreciates the organization of Manuela Ramos for helping her to reach her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, chickens, eggs and utensils for her small cafe

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon B., nicknamed “Cory” in their village located at Barangay Cataggaman Viejo Tuguegarao City. She is 45 years old and finished her secondary education. Due to financial shortage, she did not pursue her college studies. She works hard to earn a living and is married to Pedro a farmer in their village. They are gifted with three children namely; Perpetua 24 years of age college graduate; Cristopher 22 years of age, college undergraduate; Max 18 years of age, college student. Being a responsible parent, they do their best to improve their way of living. Despite the economic crisis, they are still striving for the sake of the future of their children.

Her husband is a farmer while she is engaged in barbecue vending business in their village to help her husband support the education of their children. Since she only has a small amount of capital, she only earns a net income of Php 700 a week. In this regard, she wants to borrow additional capital to strengthen her business. She applied for an amount of Php 8,000 to be added in her capital to acquire materials and ingredients needed for her business. She is so thankful when she joined in this organization because it gives her the opportunity to improve her small business. And she hopes that through her efforts and sacrifices, all of her children will finish their studies and her business will also grow. As she has said, "Patience and sacrifices is the key to success".

loans.use: additional capital for her barbecue vending business

loans.name: Mr. Mer Nget Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of 13 people who all live in Kruos village in Takeo province. Mr. Mer N. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. He is a farmer who owns a one-hectare field of land to cultivate rice. His wife, Mrs. Kong Thol, is a weaver. Since her breeding pigs business is going well, she needs some money to buy more raw materials for weaving. In order to solve this problem, Mr. Mer N. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. He is 61 years old and the father of a child who is employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials for weaving.

loans.name: Sengthai

texts.en:
Mr. Sengthai S., 27 years old, (shown in the picture with his wife) and his wife, Mrs. Sophea Yun, 22 years old, have been married since 2006 and just have a two-year-old daughter. The family lives along national road number one about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sengthai has been a motor taxi driver for seven years. His wife has been selling second-hand clothes for two years. She buys clothes from Phnom Penh market for resale at Korki market about three kilometers from her house. 

By the way, Sengthai hopes to change his business from motor taxi to Tuk Tuk, because it can carry more goods and people than a motor taxi and he will be able to generate more income as well. Therefore, he is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to purchase a trailer to drive as a Tuk Tuk taxi. He also will use a part of his loan to help his wife to buy additional second-hand clothes for resale.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer to drive as a Tuk Tuk taxi.

loans.name: Petra

texts.en:
Petra A. is a village store owner. She is married to Mar A., 51 years of age, a local tricycle driver. They are blessed with three children: Rigor- 24 years of age, a college graduate and he is a soldier; Ruby, 22 years of age, a college graduate; Robin, 15 years of age, a senior high school student. Her husband also cultivates their small farm lot by planting rice and some vegetables. Due to high cost of commodities, Petra A. wants to acquire more products but she cannot do so because she lacks business capital. Consequently, she wants to borrow additional capital from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP 25,000.00. She will use the money to purchase more goods to sell in her store. She believes that this will enable her to improve her small "sari-sari" (variety) store and earn a higher income.

Petra is 56 years old, lives in Barangay Cataggaman Viejo Tuguegarao,City. They sacrifice their time to support the needs of their youngest son, who is studying in the secondary level.

loans.use: additional capital to purchase more goods to sell in her store

loans.name: Meach

texts.en: Meach C., 44, is married with four school-aged children. She resides in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia with her husband (pictured) and children. To make a living, she runs a business selling fish at a local market in the town, earning an income of US $5 per day. Her husband always helps his wife in the business. He also operates a business selling Cambodian traditional cakes, earning an income of US $5 to help cover the family expenses. C. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, C. is asking for a loan of US $1,000 to purchase a motorbike to easily transport the fish to sell at the market. This is her second loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She hopes this loan will enable her family to cut back on public transportation expenses.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

location.town: Tboung Kmum district, Kampong Cham province, Cambo

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn B. is a hardworking lady who lives at Barangay Cataggaman Viejo Tuguegarao City. She is 42 years old and married. Her husband is a local operator of motor transport in their village. They are blessed with two diligent children: Avelino, 22 years of age college graduate, now working in Globe as a retailer and Randy, 18 years old, college student taking up Information Technology. She is a responsible mother and helps her husband in supporting their daily needs through her direct selling business of kitchen utensil products. 

Analyn wanted to request for an additional loan from the KIVA lenders amounting to Php 10,000. She will use the amount to purchase more kitchen utensils, and other products that she can offer to her customers. She believes that the more capital she will roll in her direct selling, the higher the income she could get.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora T. is a 53-year-old businesswoman from Binondo, Manila.  She got into business many years ago.  She manages her own sari-sari (general) store.  She also maintains a coin-operated video-karaoke machine.  She earns a total net income of more than P11,000.00 a month from these business activities.  She saves most of her profits so she has something to pull out of her pocket in times of emergencies.
 
She became a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2005.  Teodora applied for a new loan of P12,000.00 as additional capital for her businesses.  She is due to purchase more grocery items for her general store.  Her video-karaoke machine also needs preventive maintenance.



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items to sell and to maintain her video-karaoke machine

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad Moreno is 69 years old, widowed with 7 children and also stands as the head of the family. Currently living at fine-looking place of Tagbac, Antipolo City. She is engaged in food vending business (Preparation of foods and selling it to consumers) and also get involved in Buy and Sell of “Uling” means Charcoals, and retailing of small items and goods.

She has seven children, the eldest is 39 years old and 29 years old is the youngest. Five of her children had not finish studies in college just only finished high school because she is a poor women that couldn’t sustain well for the education of her children. Currently she has one child who is in studies in college and she hopes to finish the studies of her son through the benefit of having loans from ASHI- KIVA field Partners. She believes that her business will help them to rise up and fight for poverty and provide the needs of her son in college studies and to have a comfortable house to live with.

She plans to use the loan amounting Php 35,000 for the expansion of her business and get involved in another business to gain more profit. At her older age, she hopes for a better and more secure retirement and to enjoy the good of older life. For 15 years being a Member of ASHI she had shown a very good performance and she is being trusted by ASHI for the length of time she stayed having loan to completely achieve dreams in life to have a successful business and best in life.

loans.use: expansion of her food vending business

loans.name: Mr. Chan Koem Village Bank Group

texts.en: Fourteen people who all live in Trapeang Chaeng village in Takeo province make up the village bank loan. Mr. Chan K. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. They all will use the loan for different purposes.  He is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. He is also a pig breeder. Since his business is doing well, he wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets and pig food for breeding. His wife, Mrs. Chaet MU., is a palm sugar seller. Mr. Chan K. is a 46-year-old father of three children. Two of the children are enrolled in the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and pig food

loans.name: Yanjmaa

texts.en:
Yanjmaa T. is 39 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her daughter, Tserendulam is 18 years old and currently attends a local secondary school. T. operates a consumer goods trading business in her town therefore sells variety of small items such as tapes, CDs, costume jewelry. She started her business in 2008 after managing a clothing trading business for 4 years. She has worked hard to grow her new business and has had some success in her first year. Her business operates at a consistent level and has provided financial stability for her and her son. She has quickly increased her working capital from 230,000 tugrugs (~160 USD) when she started to 1,200,000 tugrug (~840 USD) today. She says, "Good communication with your customers is what makes a business successful." T. is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug (~700 USD) loan to purchase inventory for her business.


About XacBank
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva's 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here:http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&queryString=Mongolia&status=fundRaising&gender=All&sectors[]=All&regions[]=All&sortBy=Expiring+Soon

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her business

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria A. is from the village of Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 55 years old. Maria is married. To make a living, Maria owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Maria has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Maria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Maria is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Maria from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Saren

texts.en:
Mr. Saren S., 29 years old, (pictured with his wife) and his wife, Mrs. Chariyas El, 28 year-old, were married in 1999 and have two sons.  Both of them are still young. The family lives along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Saren has been operating a business repairing and cleaning motorcycles for two months. He runs the business at his shop in front of his house. Mrs. Chariyas assists her husband in the business.  

Saren wants to purchase more motorbike spare parts to respond to his customer’s needs. So, he is requesting a loan of $500 in order to make the purchases.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts for his stock.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta M. has run a sari-sari store (community-based store) for three years now where she earns a monthly income of Php2,000 which is not enough to sustain the needs of her family and the education of her niece. She is having a difficult time because the income of her parents as a farmer is being used as rolling capital for their farming needs since the farm inputs today are very expensive. Jacinta wants to improve her business and income and so she is requesting a loan of Php 15,000 from KIVA lenders in order to increase the amount of merchandise she carries. She hopes that her loan request will be granted soon.

At the age of 49, Jacinta is still single and enjoys her business with the support of her parents. She is living with her parents in Barangay of Cataggaman Viejo Tuguegarao City.

loans.use: additional capital to buy more items to sell

loans.name: Ana Riza

texts.en: Rice farming is the way of living of Ana. She is 29 years old with two children, her eldest is 3 years old. She started her farming business in 2006. She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to be able to support her business. Now she would like to request a loan of 15,000 Php to buy fertilizers and pay expenses in maintaining her rice field.

loans.use: Fertilizers and farm materials

loans.name: Estrellito

texts.en:
This is Estrellito S., 42, a hardworking father to four children. Two of the children are in high school and the other two in grade school.  He is married to Imelda, 43, a plain housewife. This simple family lives in Ibayong Ilat Kaong, Silang, Cavite.

Estrellito is raising pigs to get an income to support his family, especially their children’s education.  He brings his pigs to the butcher when they are ready for slaughtering.  He also manages a motorized tricycle transport and has a few boarding rooms for rent.  He earns more than P5, 000.00 a week from these business activities.

He became a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative last year in 2008.  He applied for a new loan with the cooperative in the amount of P12,000.00 to purchase bulk supplies of feedstock.  He laments that prices of commercial feed for livestock has gone up since the many calamities that came.

Estrellito dreams of seeing his children finish their school.



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase bulk supplies of feedstock for pigs

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Yen C., 45, is married with four children. She resides in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, with her husband and children. To make a living, she runs a business selling balloons, earning collectively an income of US $8 per day. Her husband always helps his wife in the business. The family is also assisted by three of her children who are able to earn an income of US $2 each per day to help cover the family expenses. C. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, C. is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase a car to operate a new business, selling kitchen utensils. This car will enable C. and her husband to transport those utensils easily for sale in her province. This is her first loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: To buy a used car

loans.name: Desireeh

texts.en:
Desireeh and her husband are working hard to earn a living for their family in order to overcome the difficulties in life, to support their daily needs, and also to send their children to school. They want them to finish their studies in college so that they will have good jobs someday.

Desireeh’s husband works as a tricycle operator in Tuguegarao City, while Desireeh manages a small sari-sari store (community based store) in front of their house selling different grocery items. Since their children are not yet enrolled in college, she needs to earn a higher income to support their daily basic needs. Therefore, Desireeh decided to borrow additional capital from Kiva lenders. She is requesting Php5,000 to purchase additional merchandise for her store. She hopes that her plan will succeed through her patience and sacrifices.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise for her store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mrs. Yen Ek Village Bank Group

texts.en: Seventeen people who live in Prey Chheu Teal village in Takeo made up this village bank loan.  Yen E. has selected the members and they will use their loan for different purposes. She is a silk weaver and her husband is a rice farmer who owns a piece of land to earn a living.  Yen requests a loan to buy raw materials to support her business and to buy fertilizer to boost the rice field.  She hopes to increase their income and improve their family lifestyle. She is 28 years old and the mother of two children. One attends school and the other is pre-school age.

loans.use: Buy raw materials and fertilizers.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita A. is 56 years old and lives in Barangay Capatan Tuguegarao City. She is a widow who has been blessed with four children, all of them are graduated from college. All of her children are married and three are working abroad as factory workers.

Estelita is very proud to have responsible and hardworking children who have finished their studies and become successful, even though we are experiencing economic crisis. She is also proud of the many sacrifices she was made for her children.

Estelita has been managing a small business of peanut butter manufacturing and selling for almost 35 years. She wanted to improve her business to be able to gain more income. She is applying for a loan of PHP 35,000 to buy ingredients for her peanut butter business, as well as feeds and medicines for her hog raising business. Securing the loan will be a great help in meeting her daily needs and goals in life.

loans.use: additional capital to buy ingredients for her peanut butter making business

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en: Tuy S., 45, is married with six children. She resides in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia with her husband and children. To make a living, she and her husband sell fruit at a local market.  They earn $11 per day.  Her husband helps his wife in the business daily. Tuy and her husband seek to improve their standard of living by generating a better income. She is asking for a loan of $1000 to purchase fruit from local farmers to resell to her customers. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: Buy fruit to resell.

loans.name: Mrs. Heng Chhom Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan involves 18 people who live in Kruos village in Takeo province.  Heng C. is the bank president and a silk weaver.  Since her business is going well, she wants to expand by purchasing more raw materials to support her business.  Her husband, Ren Reth, farms a plot of land he owns to cultivate rice. He is also a duck breeder.  Heng is 42 years old and the mother of four children.  One is a blacksmith and another is employed in a garment factory.  The others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: Buy raw materials to support her business.

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa D. is from the village of Comon, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 50 years old, married and has six adult-aged children. She owns and operates a specialized retail business selling candy, beverages, junk food and more in the local community.  Leonisa has been in business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In June 2008, Leonisa joined HSPFI to access financial services, improve her living situation and engage in business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI.  Leonisa is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offerings.  This loan will be her fourth from HSPFI.  She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family income. 
------------------------------------------
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Purchase more items to expand her business.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita N. is a 56 year old woman and mother of 7 children, 4 of them are dependents and still in schooling. She lives in Tagbak, Antipolo Rizal province in the Philippines. Her husband passed away so she is now single mother of her children.

With her belief and faith to get out of poverty, year 1999 she decided to join ASHI (Ahon SA Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines. During her previous loans, she carefully invested in her tricycle business and give her a reasonable income. Now on her 11th loan, she proposes the amount of Php 30,000 pesos as additional capital, still for her tricycle. Specifically, the amount will be used to purchase a motorcycle and sidecar.

As a mother, she dreams of sending her children to school up to college and find a job for a better living. She hopes that her business will expand for them so they will have savings for future use.

loans.use: purchase of motorcycle and sidecar

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina M. is from the village of Cataggaman Viejo, Tuguegarao City. She is married to a tricycle driver. At present they still do not have child to support, but they haven't lost hope for having one.   

Monina wants to give the best for her family so she engaged in hog raising business to support her family's needs. She is glad that she was able to sell Php5,000 per hog every three months. She is working very hard for the future of her family. She wants to improve her business and for that she would like to request a loan of Php15,000 to sustain her piggery business. She hopes that KIVA lenders will grant her requested loan.

loans.use: additional capital for her hog raising business

loans.name: Analisa

texts.en: Analisa, 39, is a farmer living in Surallah, South Cotabato. Her main source of income is rice farming. She is a mother of a 6-year-old child. She wants to improve her business and have a better future for her family. She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. on 2008 to avail financial assistance for her business. She's now requesting a loan of 15,000 Php to buy pesticides and supplies for the farm.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Lucille Mae

texts.en:
Lucille Mae A., 27, is from the village of  Mambajao, Camiguin Province.  To make a living, Lucille buys and sells ready to wear items like shirts and pants in her local community. Lucille Mae has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Lucille Mae joined HSPFI to access financial services to improve her living situation and to engage in business.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI to purchase additional products to sell.  Lucille Mae is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP to expand her business.  This loan will be her third from HSPFI.
---------------------------------
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Expanding inventory.

loans.name: Sao Men Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of 16 people who live in Kruos village in TaK. province.  Each person has a different purpose for their loan.  Sao M. is the village bank president. He is a farmer who owns a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice and vegetables.  His wife is a pig breeder. Since her breeding pigs business is going well, she wants to expand it.  Sao M. decided to request for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding and fertilizer to support his rice field.  He is 57 years old and the father of three children.  Two are enrolled in the local school while another is a silk weaver.

loans.use: Buy piglets for breeding and fertilizers for farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase dairy and raw materials

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en:
Tuy S., 38, is married with two school-aged children. She resides in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia with her family.  To make a living, she sells vegetable at a local market, earning $5 per day.  Her husband helps her every day.  He is a motorbike taxi driver and earns $3.20 per day.  He also raises cows at his home.
